2527// Detect if a mouse button has been pressed once
2528bool IsMouseButtonPressed(int button)
2529{
2530 bool pressed = false;
2531
2532 if ((CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonState[button] == 1) && (CORE.Input.Mouse.previousButtonState[button] == 0)) pressed = true;
2533
2534 // Map touches to mouse buttons checking
2535 if ((CORE.Input.Touch.currentTouchState[button] == 1) && (CORE.Input.Touch.previousTouchState[button] == 0)) pressed = true;
2536
2537 return pressed;
2538}
2539
2540// Detect if a mouse button is being pressed
2541bool IsMouseButtonDown(int button)
2542{
2543 bool down = false;
2544
2545 if (CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonState[button] == 1) down = true;
2546
2547 // Map touches to mouse buttons checking
2548 if (CORE.Input.Touch.currentTouchState[button] == 1) down = true;
2549
2550 return down;
2551}
2552
2553// Detect if a mouse button has been released once
2554bool IsMouseButtonReleased(int button)
2555{
2556 bool released = false;
2557
2558 if ((CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonState[button] == 0) && (CORE.Input.Mouse.previousButtonState[button] == 1)) released = true;
2559
2560 // Map touches to mouse buttons checking
2561 if ((CORE.Input.Touch.currentTouchState[button] == 0) && (CORE.Input.Touch.previousTouchState[button] == 1)) released = true;
2562
2563 return released;
2564}
2565
2566// Detect if a mouse button is NOT being pressed
2567bool IsMouseButtonUp(int button)
2568{
2569 return !IsMouseButtonDown(button);
2570}
2571
2572// Returns mouse position X
2573int GetMouseX(void)
2574{
2575#if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID)
2576 return (int)CORE.Input.Touch.position[0].x;
2577#else
2578 return (int)((CORE.Input.Mouse.position.x + CORE.Input.Mouse.offset.x)*CORE.Input.Mouse.scale.x);
2579#endif
2580}
2581
2582// Returns mouse position Y
2583int GetMouseY(void)
2584{
2585#if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID)
2586 return (int)CORE.Input.Touch.position[0].y;
2587#else
2588 return (int)((CORE.Input.Mouse.position.y + CORE.Input.Mouse.offset.y)*CORE.Input.Mouse.scale.y);
2589#endif
2590}
2591
2592// Returns mouse position XY
2593Vector2 GetMousePosition(void)
2594{
2595 Vector2 position = { 0 };
2596
2597#if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID) || defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
2598 position = GetTouchPosition(0);
2599#else
2600 position.x = (CORE.Input.Mouse.position.x + CORE.Input.Mouse.offset.x)*CORE.Input.Mouse.scale.x;
2601 position.y = (CORE.Input.Mouse.position.y + CORE.Input.Mouse.offset.y)*CORE.Input.Mouse.scale.y;
2602#endif
2603
2604 return position;
2605}
2606
2607// Set mouse position XY
2608void SetMousePosition(int x, int y)
2609{
2610 CORE.Input.Mouse.position = (Vector2){ (float)x, (float)y };
2611#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP) || defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
2612 // NOTE: emscripten not implemented
2613 glfwSetCursorPos(CORE.Window.handle, CORE.Input.Mouse.position.x, CORE.Input.Mouse.position.y);
2614#endif
2615#if defined(PLATFORM_UWP)
2616 UWPMessage *msg = CreateUWPMessage();
2617 msg->type = UWP_MSG_SET_MOUSE_LOCATION;
2618 msg->paramVector0.x = CORE.Input.Mouse.position.x;
2619 msg->paramVector0.y = CORE.Input.Mouse.position.y;
2620 SendMessageToUWP(msg);
2621#endif
2622}
2623
2624// Set mouse offset
2625// NOTE: Useful when rendering to different size targets
2626void SetMouseOffset(int offsetX, int offsetY)
2627{
2628 CORE.Input.Mouse.offset = (Vector2){ (float)offsetX, (float)offsetY };
2629}
2630
2631// Set mouse scaling
2632// NOTE: Useful when rendering to different size targets
2633void SetMouseScale(float scaleX, float scaleY)
2634{
2635 CORE.Input.Mouse.scale = (Vector2){ scaleX, scaleY };
2636}
2637
2638// Returns mouse wheel movement Y
2639int GetMouseWheelMove(void)
2640{
2641#if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID)
2642 return 0;
2643#elif defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
2644 return CORE.Input.Mouse.previousWheelMove/100;
2645#else
2646 return CORE.Input.Mouse.previousWheelMove;
2647#endif
2648}
2649
2650// Returns touch position X for touch point 0 (relative to screen size)
2651int GetTouchX(void)
2652{
2653#if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID) || defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
2654 return (int)CORE.Input.Touch.position[0].x;
2655#else // PLATFORM_DESKTOP, PLATFORM_RPI
2656 return GetMouseX();
2657#endif
2658}
2659
2660// Returns touch position Y for touch point 0 (relative to screen size)
2661int GetTouchY(void)
2662{
2663#if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID) || defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
2664 return (int)CORE.Input.Touch.position[0].y;
2665#else // PLATFORM_DESKTOP, PLATFORM_RPI
2666 return GetMouseY();
2667#endif
2668}
2669
2670// Returns touch position XY for a touch point index (relative to screen size)
2671// TODO: Touch position should be scaled depending on display size and render size
2672Vector2 GetTouchPosition(int index)
2673{
2674 Vector2 position = { -1.0f, -1.0f };
2675
2676#if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID) || defined(PLATFORM_WEB) || defined(PLATFORM_RPI)
2677 if (index < MAX_TOUCH_POINTS) position = CORE.Input.Touch.position[index];
2678 else TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "INPUT: Required touch point out of range (Max touch points: %i)", MAX_TOUCH_POINTS);
2679
2680 #if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID)
2681 if ((CORE.Window.screen.width > CORE.Window.display.width) || (CORE.Window.screen.height > CORE.Window.display.height))
2682 {
2683 position.x = position.x*((float)CORE.Window.screen.width/(float)(CORE.Window.display.width - CORE.Window.renderOffset.x)) - CORE.Window.renderOffset.x/2;
2684 position.y = position.y*((float)CORE.Window.screen.height/(float)(CORE.Window.display.height - CORE.Window.renderOffset.y)) - CORE.Window.renderOffset.y/2;
2685 }
2686 else
2687 {
2688 position.x = position.x*((float)CORE.Window.render.width/(float)CORE.Window.display.width) - CORE.Window.renderOffset.x/2;
2689 position.y = position.y*((float)CORE.Window.render.height/(float)CORE.Window.display.height) - CORE.Window.renderOffset.y/2;
2690 }
2691 #endif
2692
2693#elif defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP)
2694 // TODO: GLFW is not supporting multi-touch input just yet
2695 // https://www.codeproject.com/Articles/668404/Programming-for-Multi-Touch
2696 // https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/wintouch/getting-started-with-multi-touch-messages
2697 if (index == 0) position = GetMousePosition();
2698#endif
2699
2700 return position;
2701}
2702
2703//----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2704// Module specific Functions Definition
2705//----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2706
2707// Initialize display device and framebuffer
2708// NOTE: width and height represent the screen (framebuffer) desired size, not actual display size
2709// If width or height are 0, default display size will be used for framebuffer size
2710// NOTE: returns false in case graphic device could not be created
2711static bool InitGraphicsDevice(int width, int height)
2712{
2713 CORE.Window.screen.width = width; // User desired width
2714 CORE.Window.screen.height = height; // User desired height
2715
2716 CORE.Window.screenScale = MatrixIdentity(); // No draw scaling required by default
2717
2718 // NOTE: Framebuffer (render area - CORE.Window.render.width, CORE.Window.render.height) could include black bars...
2719 // ...in top-down or left-right to match display aspect ratio (no weird scalings)
2720
2721#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP) || defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
2722 glfwSetErrorCallback(ErrorCallback);
2723
2724#if defined(__APPLE__)
2725 glfwInitHint(GLFW_COCOA_CHDIR_RESOURCES, GLFW_FALSE);
2726#endif
2727
2728 if (!glfwInit())
2729 {
2730 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "GLFW: Failed to initialize GLFW");
2731 return false;
2732 }
2733
2734 // NOTE: Getting video modes is not implemented in emscripten GLFW3 version
2735#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP)
2736 // Find monitor resolution
2737 GLFWmonitor *monitor = glfwGetPrimaryMonitor();
2738 if (!monitor)
2739 {
2740 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "GLFW: Failed to get primary monitor");
2741 return false;
2742 }
2743 const GLFWvidmode *mode = glfwGetVideoMode(monitor);
2744
2745 CORE.Window.display.width = mode->width;
2746 CORE.Window.display.height = mode->height;
2747
2748 // Screen size security check
2749 if (CORE.Window.screen.width <= 0) CORE.Window.screen.width = CORE.Window.display.width;
2750 if (CORE.Window.screen.height <= 0) CORE.Window.screen.height = CORE.Window.display.height;
2751#endif // PLATFORM_DESKTOP
2752
2753#if defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
2754 CORE.Window.display.width = CORE.Window.screen.width;
2755 CORE.Window.display.height = CORE.Window.screen.height;
2756#endif // PLATFORM_WEB
2757
2758 glfwDefaultWindowHints(); // Set default windows hints:
2759 //glfwWindowHint(GLFW_RED_BITS, 8); // Framebuffer red color component bits
2760 //glfwWindowHint(GLFW_GREEN_BITS, 8); // Framebuffer green color component bits
2761 //glfwWindowHint(GLFW_BLUE_BITS, 8); // Framebuffer blue color component bits
2762 //glfwWindowHint(GLFW_ALPHA_BITS, 8); // Framebuffer alpha color component bits
2763 //glfwWindowHint(GLFW_DEPTH_BITS, 24); // Depthbuffer bits
2764 //glfwWindowHint(GLFW_REFRESH_RATE, 0); // Refresh rate for fullscreen window
2765 //glfwWindowHint(GLFW_CLIENT_API, GLFW_OPENGL_API); // OpenGL API to use. Alternative: GLFW_OPENGL_ES_API
2766 //glfwWindowHint(GLFW_AUX_BUFFERS, 0); // Number of auxiliar buffers
2767#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP) && defined(SUPPORT_HIGH_DPI)
2768 // Resize window content area based on the monitor content scale.
2769 // NOTE: This hint only has an effect on platforms where screen coordinates and pixels always map 1:1 such as Windows and X11.
2770 // On platforms like macOS the resolution of the framebuffer is changed independently of the window size.
2771 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_SCALE_TO_MONITOR, GLFW_TRUE); // Scale content area based on the monitor content scale where window is placed on
2772#endif
2773
2774 // Check some Window creation flags
2775 if (CORE.Window.flags & FLAG_WINDOW_HIDDEN) glfwWindowHint(GLFW_VISIBLE, GL_FALSE); // Visible window
2776 else glfwWindowHint(GLFW_VISIBLE, GL_TRUE); // Window initially hidden
2777
2778 if (CORE.Window.flags & FLAG_WINDOW_RESIZABLE) glfwWindowHint(GLFW_RESIZABLE, GL_TRUE); // Resizable window
2779 else glfwWindowHint(GLFW_RESIZABLE, GL_FALSE); // Avoid window being resizable
2780
2781 if (CORE.Window.flags & FLAG_WINDOW_UNDECORATED) glfwWindowHint(GLFW_DECORATED, GLFW_FALSE); // Border and buttons on Window
2782 else glfwWindowHint(GLFW_DECORATED, GLFW_TRUE); // Decorated window
2783 // FLAG_WINDOW_TRANSPARENT not supported on HTML5 and not included in any released GLFW version yet
2784#if defined(GLFW_TRANSPARENT_FRAMEBUFFER)
2785 if (CORE.Window.flags & FLAG_WINDOW_TRANSPARENT) glfwWindowHint(GLFW_TRANSPARENT_FRAMEBUFFER, GLFW_TRUE); // Transparent framebuffer
2786 else glfwWindowHint(GLFW_TRANSPARENT_FRAMEBUFFER, GLFW_FALSE); // Opaque framebuffer
2787#endif
2788
2789 if (CORE.Window.flags & FLAG_MSAA_4X_HINT) glfwWindowHint(GLFW_SAMPLES, 4); // Tries to enable multisampling x4 (MSAA), default is 0
2790
2791 // NOTE: When asking for an OpenGL context version, most drivers provide highest supported version
2792 // with forward compatibility to older OpenGL versions.
2793 // For example, if using OpenGL 1.1, driver can provide a 4.3 context forward compatible.
2794
2795 // Check selection OpenGL version
2796 if (rlGetVersion() == OPENGL_21)
2797 {
2798 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_CONTEXT_VERSION_MAJOR, 2); // Choose OpenGL major version (just hint)
2799 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_CONTEXT_VERSION_MINOR, 1); // Choose OpenGL minor version (just hint)
2800 }
2801 else if (rlGetVersion() == OPENGL_33)
2802 {
2803 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_CONTEXT_VERSION_MAJOR, 3); // Choose OpenGL major version (just hint)
2804 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_CONTEXT_VERSION_MINOR, 3); // Choose OpenGL minor version (just hint)
2805 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_OPENGL_PROFILE, GLFW_OPENGL_CORE_PROFILE); // Profiles Hint: Only 3.3 and above!
2806 // Values: GLFW_OPENGL_CORE_PROFILE, GLFW_OPENGL_ANY_PROFILE, GLFW_OPENGL_COMPAT_PROFILE
2807#if defined(__APPLE__)
2808 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_OPENGL_FORWARD_COMPAT, GLFW_TRUE); // OSX Requires fordward compatibility
2809#else
2810 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_OPENGL_FORWARD_COMPAT, GLFW_FALSE); // Fordward Compatibility Hint: Only 3.3 and above!
2811#endif
2812 //glfwWindowHint(GLFW_OPENGL_DEBUG_CONTEXT, GLFW_TRUE); // Request OpenGL DEBUG context
2813 }
2814 else if (rlGetVersion() == OPENGL_ES_20) // Request OpenGL ES 2.0 context
2815 {
2816 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_CONTEXT_VERSION_MAJOR, 2);
2817 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_CONTEXT_VERSION_MINOR, 0);
2818 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_CLIENT_API, GLFW_OPENGL_ES_API);
2819#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP)
2820 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_CONTEXT_CREATION_API, GLFW_EGL_CONTEXT_API);
2821#else
2822 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_CONTEXT_CREATION_API, GLFW_NATIVE_CONTEXT_API);
2823#endif
2824 }
2825
2826 if (CORE.Window.fullscreen)
2827 {
2828 // remember center for switchinging from fullscreen to window
2829 CORE.Window.position.x = CORE.Window.display.width/2 - CORE.Window.screen.width/2;
2830 CORE.Window.position.y = CORE.Window.display.height/2 - CORE.Window.screen.height/2;
2831
2832 if (CORE.Window.position.x < 0) CORE.Window.position.x = 0;
2833 if (CORE.Window.position.y < 0) CORE.Window.position.y = 0;
2834
2835 // Obtain recommended CORE.Window.display.width/CORE.Window.display.height from a valid videomode for the monitor
2836 int count = 0;
2837 const GLFWvidmode *modes = glfwGetVideoModes(glfwGetPrimaryMonitor(), &count);
2838
2839 // Get closest video mode to desired CORE.Window.screen.width/CORE.Window.screen.height
2840 for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
2841 {
2842 if (modes[i].width >= CORE.Window.screen.width)
2843 {
2844 if (modes[i].height >= CORE.Window.screen.height)
2845 {
2846 CORE.Window.display.width = modes[i].width;
2847 CORE.Window.display.height = modes[i].height;
2848 break;
2849 }
2850 }
2851 }
2852
2853#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP)
2854 // If we are windowed fullscreen, ensures that window does not minimize when focus is lost
2855 if ((CORE.Window.screen.height == CORE.Window.display.height) && (CORE.Window.screen.width == CORE.Window.display.width))
2856 {
2857 glfwWindowHint(GLFW_AUTO_ICONIFY, 0);
2858 }
2859#endif
2860
2861 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "SYSTEM: Closest fullscreen videomode: %i x %i", CORE.Window.display.width, CORE.Window.display.height);
2862
2863 // NOTE: ISSUE: Closest videomode could not match monitor aspect-ratio, for example,
2864 // for a desired screen size of 800x450 (16:9), closest supported videomode is 800x600 (4:3),
2865 // framebuffer is rendered correctly but once displayed on a 16:9 monitor, it gets stretched
2866 // by the sides to fit all monitor space...
2867
2868 // Try to setup the most appropiate fullscreen framebuffer for the requested screenWidth/screenHeight
2869 // It considers device display resolution mode and setups a framebuffer with black bars if required (render size/offset)
2870 // Modified global variables: CORE.Window.screen.width/CORE.Window.screen.height - CORE.Window.render.width/CORE.Window.render.height - CORE.Window.renderOffset.x/CORE.Window.renderOffset.y - CORE.Window.screenScale
2871 // TODO: It is a quite cumbersome solution to display size vs requested size, it should be reviewed or removed...
2872 // HighDPI monitors are properly considered in a following similar function: SetupViewport()
2873 SetupFramebuffer(CORE.Window.display.width, CORE.Window.display.height);
2874
2875 CORE.Window.handle = glfwCreateWindow(CORE.Window.display.width, CORE.Window.display.height, CORE.Window.title, glfwGetPrimaryMonitor(), NULL);
2876
2877 // NOTE: Full-screen change, not working properly...
2878 //glfwSetWindowMonitor(CORE.Window.handle, glfwGetPrimaryMonitor(), 0, 0, CORE.Window.screen.width, CORE.Window.screen.height, GLFW_DONT_CARE);
2879 }
2880 else
2881 {
2882 // No-fullscreen window creation
2883 CORE.Window.handle = glfwCreateWindow(CORE.Window.screen.width, CORE.Window.screen.height, CORE.Window.title, NULL, NULL);
2884
2885 if (CORE.Window.handle)
2886 {
2887#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP)
2888 // Center window on screen
2889 int windowPosX = CORE.Window.display.width/2 - CORE.Window.screen.width/2;
2890 int windowPosY = CORE.Window.display.height/2 - CORE.Window.screen.height/2;
2891
2892 if (windowPosX < 0) windowPosX = 0;
2893 if (windowPosY < 0) windowPosY = 0;
2894
2895 glfwSetWindowPos(CORE.Window.handle, windowPosX, windowPosY);
2896#endif
2897 CORE.Window.render.width = CORE.Window.screen.width;
2898 CORE.Window.render.height = CORE.Window.screen.height;
2899 }
2900 }
2901
2902 if (!CORE.Window.handle)
2903 {
2904 glfwTerminate();
2905 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "GLFW: Failed to initialize Window");
2906 return false;
2907 }
2908 else
2909 {
2910 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, "DISPLAY: Device initialized successfully");
2911#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP)
2912 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, " > Display size: %i x %i", CORE.Window.display.width, CORE.Window.display.height);
2913#endif
2914 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, " > Render size: %i x %i", CORE.Window.render.width, CORE.Window.render.height);
2915 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, " > Screen size: %i x %i", CORE.Window.screen.width, CORE.Window.screen.height);
2916 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, " > Viewport offsets: %i, %i", CORE.Window.renderOffset.x, CORE.Window.renderOffset.y);
2917 }
2918
2919 glfwSetWindowSizeCallback(CORE.Window.handle, WindowSizeCallback); // NOTE: Resizing not allowed by default!
2920 glfwSetCursorEnterCallback(CORE.Window.handle, CursorEnterCallback);
2921 glfwSetKeyCallback(CORE.Window.handle, KeyCallback);
2922 glfwSetMouseButtonCallback(CORE.Window.handle, MouseButtonCallback);
2923 glfwSetCursorPosCallback(CORE.Window.handle, MouseCursorPosCallback); // Track mouse position changes
2924 glfwSetCharCallback(CORE.Window.handle, CharCallback);
2925 glfwSetScrollCallback(CORE.Window.handle, ScrollCallback);
2926 glfwSetWindowIconifyCallback(CORE.Window.handle, WindowIconifyCallback);
2927 glfwSetDropCallback(CORE.Window.handle, WindowDropCallback);
2928
2929 glfwMakeContextCurrent(CORE.Window.handle);
2930
2931#if !defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
2932 glfwSwapInterval(0); // No V-Sync by default
2933#endif
2934
2935#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP)
2936 // Load OpenGL 3.3 extensions
2937 // NOTE: GLFW loader function is passed as parameter
2938 rlLoadExtensions(glfwGetProcAddress);
2939#endif
2940
2941 // Try to enable GPU V-Sync, so frames are limited to screen refresh rate (60Hz -> 60 FPS)
2942 // NOTE: V-Sync can be enabled by graphic driver configuration
2943 if (CORE.Window.flags & FLAG_VSYNC_HINT)
2944 {
2945 // WARNING: It seems to hits a critical render path in Intel HD Graphics
2946 glfwSwapInterval(1);
2947 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, "DISPLAY: Trying to enable VSYNC");
2948 }
2949#endif // PLATFORM_DESKTOP || PLATFORM_WEB
2950
2951#if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID) || defined(PLATFORM_RPI) || defined(PLATFORM_UWP)
2952 CORE.Window.fullscreen = true;
2953
2954 // Screen size security check
2955 if (CORE.Window.screen.width <= 0) CORE.Window.screen.width = CORE.Window.display.width;
2956 if (CORE.Window.screen.height <= 0) CORE.Window.screen.height = CORE.Window.display.height;
2957
2958#if defined(PLATFORM_RPI)
2959 bcm_host_init();
2960
2961 DISPMANX_ELEMENT_HANDLE_T dispmanElement;
2962 DISPMANX_DISPLAY_HANDLE_T dispmanDisplay;
2963 DISPMANX_UPDATE_HANDLE_T dispmanUpdate;
2964
2965 VC_RECT_T dstRect;
2966 VC_RECT_T srcRect;
2967#endif
2968
2969 EGLint samples = 0;
2970 EGLint sampleBuffer = 0;
2971 if (CORE.Window.flags & FLAG_MSAA_4X_HINT)
2972 {
2973 samples = 4;
2974 sampleBuffer = 1;
2975 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, "DISPLAY: Trying to enable MSAA x4");
2976 }
2977
2978 const EGLint framebufferAttribs[] =
2979 {
2980 EGL_RENDERABLE_TYPE, EGL_OPENGL_ES2_BIT, // Type of context support -> Required on RPI?
2981 //EGL_SURFACE_TYPE, EGL_WINDOW_BIT, // Don't use it on Android!
2982 EGL_RED_SIZE, 8, // RED color bit depth (alternative: 5)
2983 EGL_GREEN_SIZE, 8, // GREEN color bit depth (alternative: 6)
2984 EGL_BLUE_SIZE, 8, // BLUE color bit depth (alternative: 5)
2985 //EGL_ALPHA_SIZE, 8, // ALPHA bit depth (required for transparent framebuffer)
2986 //EGL_TRANSPARENT_TYPE, EGL_NONE, // Request transparent framebuffer (EGL_TRANSPARENT_RGB does not work on RPI)
2987 EGL_DEPTH_SIZE, 16, // Depth buffer size (Required to use Depth testing!)
2988 //EGL_STENCIL_SIZE, 8, // Stencil buffer size
2989 EGL_SAMPLE_BUFFERS, sampleBuffer, // Activate MSAA
2990 EGL_SAMPLES, samples, // 4x Antialiasing if activated (Free on MALI GPUs)
2991 EGL_NONE
2992 };

2995 {

2997 EGL_NONE
2998 };
2999
3000#if defined(PLATFORM_UWP)

3002 {

3025
3026 const EGLint fl9_3DisplayAttributes[] =
3027 {
3028 // These can be used to request ANGLE's D3D11 renderer, with D3D11 Feature Level 9_3.
3029 // These attributes are used if the call to eglInitialize fails with the default display attributes.
3030 EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_ANGLE, EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_D3D11_ANGLE,
3031 EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_MAX_VERSION_MAJOR_ANGLE, 9,
3032 EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_MAX_VERSION_MINOR_ANGLE, 3,
3033 EGL_ANGLE_DISPLAY_ALLOW_RENDER_TO_BACK_BUFFER, EGL_TRUE,
3034 EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_ENABLE_AUTOMATIC_TRIM_ANGLE, EGL_TRUE,
3035 EGL_NONE,
3036 };
3037
3038 const EGLint warpDisplayAttributes[] =
3039 {
3040 // These attributes can be used to request D3D11 WARP.
3041 // They are used if eglInitialize fails with both the default display attributes and the 9_3 display attributes.
3042 EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_ANGLE, EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_TYPE_D3D11_ANGLE,
3043 EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_DEVICE_TYPE_ANGLE, EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_DEVICE_TYPE_WARP_ANGLE,
3044 EGL_ANGLE_DISPLAY_ALLOW_RENDER_TO_BACK_BUFFER, EGL_TRUE,
3045 EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_ENABLE_AUTOMATIC_TRIM_ANGLE, EGL_TRUE,
3046 EGL_NONE,
3047 };
3048
3049 // eglGetPlatformDisplayEXT is an alternative to eglGetDisplay. It allows us to pass in display attributes, used to configure D3D11.
3050 PFNEGLGETPLATFORMDISPLAYEXTPROC eglGetPlatformDisplayEXT = (PFNEGLGETPLATFORMDISPLAYEXTPROC)(eglGetProcAddress("eglGetPlatformDisplayEXT"));
3051 if (!eglGetPlatformDisplayEXT)
3052 {
3053 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Failed to get function eglGetPlatformDisplayEXT");
3054 return false;
3055 }
3056
3057 //
3058 // To initialize the display, we make three sets of calls to eglGetPlatformDisplayEXT and eglInitialize, with varying
3059 // parameters passed to eglGetPlatformDisplayEXT:
3060 // 1) The first calls uses "defaultDisplayAttributes" as a parameter. This corresponds to D3D11 Feature Level 10_0+.
3061 // 2) If eglInitialize fails for step 1 (e.g. because 10_0+ isn't supported by the default GPU), then we try again
3062 // using "fl9_3DisplayAttributes". This corresponds to D3D11 Feature Level 9_3.
3063 // 3) If eglInitialize fails for step 2 (e.g. because 9_3+ isn't supported by the default GPU), then we try again
3064 // using "warpDisplayAttributes". This corresponds to D3D11 Feature Level 11_0 on WARP, a D3D11 software rasterizer.
3065 //
3066
3067 // This tries to initialize EGL to D3D11 Feature Level 10_0+. See above comment for details.
3068 CORE.Window.device = eglGetPlatformDisplayEXT(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_ANGLE, EGL_DEFAULT_DISPLAY, defaultDisplayAttributes);
3069 if (CORE.Window.device == EGL_NO_DISPLAY)
3070 {
3071 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Failed to initialize EGL device");
3072 return false;
3073 }
3074
3075 if (eglInitialize(CORE.Window.device, NULL, NULL) == EGL_FALSE)
3076 {
3077 // This tries to initialize EGL to D3D11 Feature Level 9_3, if 10_0+ is unavailable (e.g. on some mobile devices).
3078 CORE.Window.device = eglGetPlatformDisplayEXT(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_ANGLE, EGL_DEFAULT_DISPLAY, fl9_3DisplayAttributes);
3079 if (CORE.Window.device == EGL_NO_DISPLAY)
3080 {
3081 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Failed to initialize EGL device");
3082 return false;
3083 }
3084
3085 if (eglInitialize(CORE.Window.device, NULL, NULL) == EGL_FALSE)
3086 {
3087 // This initializes EGL to D3D11 Feature Level 11_0 on WARP, if 9_3+ is unavailable on the default GPU.
3088 CORE.Window.device = eglGetPlatformDisplayEXT(EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_ANGLE, EGL_DEFAULT_DISPLAY, warpDisplayAttributes);
3089 if (CORE.Window.device == EGL_NO_DISPLAY)
3090 {
3091 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Failed to initialize EGL device");
3092 return false;
3093 }
3094
3095 if (eglInitialize(CORE.Window.device, NULL, NULL) == EGL_FALSE)
3096 {
3097 // If all of the calls to eglInitialize returned EGL_FALSE then an error has occurred.
3098 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Failed to initialize EGL device");
3099 return false;
3100 }
3101 }
3102 }
3103
3104 EGLint numConfigs = 0;
3105 if ((eglChooseConfig(CORE.Window.device, framebufferAttribs, &CORE.Window.config, 1, &numConfigs) == EGL_FALSE) || (numConfigs == 0))
3106 {
3107 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Failed to choose first EGL configuration");
3108 return false;
3109 }
3110
3111 // Create a PropertySet and initialize with the EGLNativeWindowType.
3112 //PropertySet^ surfaceCreationProperties = ref new PropertySet();
3113 //surfaceCreationProperties->Insert(ref new String(EGLNativeWindowTypeProperty), window); // CoreWindow^ window
3114
3115 // You can configure the surface to render at a lower resolution and be scaled up to
3116 // the full window size. The scaling is often free on mobile hardware.
3117 //
3118 // One way to configure the SwapChainPanel is to specify precisely which resolution it should render at.
3119 // Size customRenderSurfaceSize = Size(800, 600);
3120 // surfaceCreationProperties->Insert(ref new String(EGLRenderSurfaceSizeProperty), PropertyValue::CreateSize(customRenderSurfaceSize));
3121 //
3122 // Another way is to tell the SwapChainPanel to render at a certain scale factor compared to its size.
3123 // e.g. if the SwapChainPanel is 1920x1280 then setting a factor of 0.5f will make the app render at 960x640
3124 // float customResolutionScale = 0.5f;
3125 // surfaceCreationProperties->Insert(ref new String(EGLRenderResolutionScaleProperty), PropertyValue::CreateSingle(customResolutionScale));
3126
3127
3128 // eglCreateWindowSurface() requires a EGLNativeWindowType parameter,
3129 // In Windows platform: typedef HWND EGLNativeWindowType;
3130
3131
3132 // Property: EGLNativeWindowTypeProperty
3133 // Type: IInspectable
3134 // Description: Set this property to specify the window type to use for creating a surface.
3135 // If this property is missing, surface creation will fail.
3136 //
3137 //const wchar_t EGLNativeWindowTypeProperty[] = L"EGLNativeWindowTypeProperty";
3138
3139 //https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46550182/how-to-create-eglsurface-using-c-winrt-and-angle
3140
3141 //CORE.Window.surface = eglCreateWindowSurface(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.config, reinterpret_cast<IInspectable*>(surfaceCreationProperties), surfaceAttributes);
3142 CORE.Window.surface = eglCreateWindowSurface(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.config, handle, surfaceAttributes);
3143 if (CORE.Window.surface == EGL_NO_SURFACE)
3144 {
3145 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Failed to create EGL fullscreen surface");
3146 return false;
3147 }
3148
3149 CORE.Window.context = eglCreateContext(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.config, EGL_NO_CONTEXT, contextAttribs);
3150 if (CORE.Window.context == EGL_NO_CONTEXT)
3151 {
3152 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Failed to create EGL context");
3153 return false;
3154 }
3155
3156 // Get EGL device window size
3157 eglQuerySurface(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.surface, EGL_WIDTH, &CORE.Window.screen.width);
3158 eglQuerySurface(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.surface, EGL_HEIGHT, &CORE.Window.screen.height);
3159
3160#else // PLATFORM_ANDROID, PLATFORM_RPI
3161 EGLint numConfigs;
3162
3163 // Get an EGL device connection
3164 CORE.Window.device = eglGetDisplay(EGL_DEFAULT_DISPLAY);
3165 if (CORE.Window.device == EGL_NO_DISPLAY)
3166 {
3167 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Failed to initialize EGL device");
3168 return false;
3169 }
3170
3171 // Initialize the EGL device connection
3172 if (eglInitialize(CORE.Window.device, NULL, NULL) == EGL_FALSE)
3173 {
3174 // If all of the calls to eglInitialize returned EGL_FALSE then an error has occurred.
3175 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Failed to initialize EGL device");
3176 return false;
3177 }
3178
3179 // Get an appropriate EGL framebuffer configuration
3180 eglChooseConfig(CORE.Window.device, framebufferAttribs, &CORE.Window.config, 1, &numConfigs);
3181
3182 // Set rendering API
3183 eglBindAPI(EGL_OPENGL_ES_API);
3184
3185 // Create an EGL rendering context
3186 CORE.Window.context = eglCreateContext(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.config, EGL_NO_CONTEXT, contextAttribs);
3187 if (CORE.Window.context == EGL_NO_CONTEXT)
3188 {
3189 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Failed to create EGL context");
3190 return false;
3191 }
3192#endif
3193
3194 // Create an EGL window surface
3195 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3196#if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID)
3197 EGLint displayFormat;
3198
3199 // EGL_NATIVE_VISUAL_ID is an attribute of the EGLConfig that is guaranteed to be accepted by ANativeWindow_setBuffersGeometry()
3200 // As soon as we picked a EGLConfig, we can safely reconfigure the ANativeWindow buffers to match, using EGL_NATIVE_VISUAL_ID
3201 eglGetConfigAttrib(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.config, EGL_NATIVE_VISUAL_ID, &displayFormat);
3202
3203 // At this point we need to manage render size vs screen size
3204 // NOTE: This function use and modify global module variables: CORE.Window.screen.width/CORE.Window.screen.height and CORE.Window.render.width/CORE.Window.render.height and CORE.Window.screenScale
3205 SetupFramebuffer(CORE.Window.display.width, CORE.Window.display.height);
3206
3207 ANativeWindow_setBuffersGeometry(CORE.Android.app->window, CORE.Window.render.width, CORE.Window.render.height, displayFormat);
3208 //ANativeWindow_setBuffersGeometry(CORE.Android.app->window, 0, 0, displayFormat); // Force use of native display size
3209
3210 CORE.Window.surface = eglCreateWindowSurface(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.config, CORE.Android.app->window, NULL);
3211#endif // PLATFORM_ANDROID
3212
3213#if defined(PLATFORM_RPI)
3214 graphics_get_display_size(0, &CORE.Window.display.width, &CORE.Window.display.height);
3215
3216 // At this point we need to manage render size vs screen size
3217 // NOTE: This function use and modify global module variables: CORE.Window.screen.width/CORE.Window.screen.height and CORE.Window.render.width/CORE.Window.render.height and CORE.Window.screenScale
3218 SetupFramebuffer(CORE.Window.display.width, CORE.Window.display.height);
3219
3220 dstRect.x = 0;
3221 dstRect.y = 0;
3222 dstRect.width = CORE.Window.display.width;
3223 dstRect.height = CORE.Window.display.height;
3224
3225 srcRect.x = 0;
3226 srcRect.y = 0;
3227 srcRect.width = CORE.Window.render.width << 16;
3228 srcRect.height = CORE.Window.render.height << 16;
3229
3230 // NOTE: RPI dispmanx windowing system takes care of srcRec scaling to dstRec by hardware (no cost)
3231 // Take care that renderWidth/renderHeight fit on displayWidth/displayHeight aspect ratio
3232
3233 VC_DISPMANX_ALPHA_T alpha;
3234 alpha.flags = DISPMANX_FLAGS_ALPHA_FIXED_ALL_PIXELS;
3235 //alpha.flags = DISPMANX_FLAGS_ALPHA_FROM_SOURCE; // TODO: Allow transparent framebuffer! -> FLAG_WINDOW_TRANSPARENT
3236 alpha.opacity = 255; // Set transparency level for framebuffer, requires EGLAttrib: EGL_TRANSPARENT_TYPE
3237 alpha.mask = 0;
3238
3239 dispmanDisplay = vc_dispmanx_display_open(0); // LCD
3240 dispmanUpdate = vc_dispmanx_update_start(0);
3241
3242 dispmanElement = vc_dispmanx_element_add(dispmanUpdate, dispmanDisplay, 0/*layer*/, &dstRect, 0/*src*/,
3243 &srcRect, DISPMANX_PROTECTION_NONE, &alpha, 0/*clamp*/, DISPMANX_NO_ROTATE);
3244
3245 CORE.Window.handle.element = dispmanElement;
3246 CORE.Window.handle.width = CORE.Window.render.width;
3247 CORE.Window.handle.height = CORE.Window.render.height;
3248 vc_dispmanx_update_submit_sync(dispmanUpdate);
3249
3250 CORE.Window.surface = eglCreateWindowSurface(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.config, &CORE.Window.handle, NULL);
3251 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3252#endif // PLATFORM_RPI
3253
3254 // There must be at least one frame displayed before the buffers are swapped
3255 //eglSwapInterval(CORE.Window.device, 1);
3256
3257 if (eglMakeCurrent(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.surface, CORE.Window.surface, CORE.Window.context) == EGL_FALSE)
3258 {
3259 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Failed to attach EGL rendering context to EGL surface");
3260 return false;
3261 }
3262 else
3263 {
3264 // Grab the width and height of the surface
3265 //eglQuerySurface(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.surface, EGL_WIDTH, &CORE.Window.render.width);
3266 //eglQuerySurface(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.surface, EGL_HEIGHT, &CORE.Window.render.height);
3267
3268 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, "DISPLAY: Device initialized successfully");
3269 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, " > Display size: %i x %i", CORE.Window.display.width, CORE.Window.display.height);
3270 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, " > Render size: %i x %i", CORE.Window.render.width, CORE.Window.render.height);
3271 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, " > Screen size: %i x %i", CORE.Window.screen.width, CORE.Window.screen.height);
3272 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, " > Viewport offsets: %i, %i", CORE.Window.renderOffset.x, CORE.Window.renderOffset.y);
3273 }
3274#endif // PLATFORM_ANDROID || PLATFORM_RPI
3275
3276 // Initialize OpenGL context (states and resources)
3277 // NOTE: CORE.Window.screen.width and CORE.Window.screen.height not used, just stored as globals in rlgl
3278 rlglInit(CORE.Window.screen.width, CORE.Window.screen.height);
3279
3280 int fbWidth = CORE.Window.render.width;
3281 int fbHeight = CORE.Window.render.height;
3282
3283#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP) && defined(SUPPORT_HIGH_DPI)
3284 glfwGetFramebufferSize(CORE.Window.handle, &fbWidth, &fbHeight);
3285
3286 // Screen scaling matrix is required in case desired screen area is different than display area
3287 CORE.Window.screenScale = MatrixScale((float)fbWidth/CORE.Window.screen.width, (float)fbHeight/CORE.Window.screen.height, 1.0f);
3288#if !defined(__APPLE__)
3289 SetMouseScale((float)CORE.Window.screen.width/fbWidth, (float)CORE.Window.screen.height/fbHeight);
3290#endif
3291#endif // PLATFORM_DESKTOP && SUPPORT_HIGH_DPI
3292
3293 // Setup default viewport
3294 SetupViewport(fbWidth, fbHeight);
3295
3296 CORE.Window.currentFbo.width = CORE.Window.screen.width;
3297 CORE.Window.currentFbo.height = CORE.Window.screen.height;
3298
3299 ClearBackground(RAYWHITE); // Default background color for raylib games :P
3300
3301#if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID)
3302 CORE.Window.ready = true;
3303#endif
3304 return true;
3305}
3306
3307// Set viewport for a provided width and height
3308static void SetupViewport(int width, int height)
3309{
3310 CORE.Window.render.width = width;
3311 CORE.Window.render.height = height;
3312
3313 // Set viewport width and height
3314 // NOTE: We consider render size and offset in case black bars are required and
3315 // render area does not match full display area (this situation is only applicable on fullscreen mode)
3316 rlViewport(CORE.Window.renderOffset.x/2, CORE.Window.renderOffset.y/2, CORE.Window.render.width - CORE.Window.renderOffset.x, CORE.Window.render.height - CORE.Window.renderOffset.y);
3317
3318 rlMatrixMode(RL_PROJECTION); // Switch to PROJECTION matrix
3319 rlLoadIdentity(); // Reset current matrix (PROJECTION)
3320
3321 // Set orthographic projection to current framebuffer size
3322 // NOTE: Configured top-left corner as (0, 0)
3323 rlOrtho(0, CORE.Window.render.width, CORE.Window.render.height, 0, 0.0f, 1.0f);
3324
3325 rlMatrixMode(RL_MODELVIEW); // Switch back to MODELVIEW matrix
3326 rlLoadIdentity(); // Reset current matrix (MODELVIEW)
3327}
3328
3329// Compute framebuffer size relative to screen size and display size
3330// NOTE: Global variables CORE.Window.render.width/CORE.Window.render.height and CORE.Window.renderOffset.x/CORE.Window.renderOffset.y can be modified
3331static void SetupFramebuffer(int width, int height)
3332{
3333 // Calculate CORE.Window.render.width and CORE.Window.render.height, we have the display size (input params) and the desired screen size (global var)
3334 if ((CORE.Window.screen.width > CORE.Window.display.width) || (CORE.Window.screen.height > CORE.Window.display.height))
3335 {
3336 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Downscaling required: Screen size (%ix%i) is bigger than display size (%ix%i)", CORE.Window.screen.width, CORE.Window.screen.height, CORE.Window.display.width, CORE.Window.display.height);
3337
3338 // Downscaling to fit display with border-bars
3339 float widthRatio = (float)CORE.Window.display.width/(float)CORE.Window.screen.width;
3340 float heightRatio = (float)CORE.Window.display.height/(float)CORE.Window.screen.height;
3341
3342 if (widthRatio <= heightRatio)
3343 {
3344 CORE.Window.render.width = CORE.Window.display.width;
3345 CORE.Window.render.height = (int)round((float)CORE.Window.screen.height*widthRatio);
3346 CORE.Window.renderOffset.x = 0;
3347 CORE.Window.renderOffset.y = (CORE.Window.display.height - CORE.Window.render.height);
3348 }
3349 else
3350 {
3351 CORE.Window.render.width = (int)round((float)CORE.Window.screen.width*heightRatio);
3352 CORE.Window.render.height = CORE.Window.display.height;
3353 CORE.Window.renderOffset.x = (CORE.Window.display.width - CORE.Window.render.width);
3354 CORE.Window.renderOffset.y = 0;
3355 }
3356
3357 // Screen scaling required
3358 float scaleRatio = (float)CORE.Window.render.width/(float)CORE.Window.screen.width;
3359 CORE.Window.screenScale = MatrixScale(scaleRatio, scaleRatio, 1.0f);
3360
3361 // NOTE: We render to full display resolution!
3362 // We just need to calculate above parameters for downscale matrix and offsets
3363 CORE.Window.render.width = CORE.Window.display.width;
3364 CORE.Window.render.height = CORE.Window.display.height;
3365
3366 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "DISPLAY: Downscale matrix generated, content will be rendered at (%ix%i)", CORE.Window.render.width, CORE.Window.render.height);
3367 }
3368 else if ((CORE.Window.screen.width < CORE.Window.display.width) || (CORE.Window.screen.height < CORE.Window.display.height))
3369 {
3370 // Required screen size is smaller than display size
3371 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, "DISPLAY: Upscaling required: Screen size (%ix%i) smaller than display size (%ix%i)", CORE.Window.screen.width, CORE.Window.screen.height, CORE.Window.display.width, CORE.Window.display.height);
3372
3373 // Upscaling to fit display with border-bars
3374 float displayRatio = (float)CORE.Window.display.width/(float)CORE.Window.display.height;
3375 float screenRatio = (float)CORE.Window.screen.width/(float)CORE.Window.screen.height;
3376
3377 if (displayRatio <= screenRatio)
3378 {
3379 CORE.Window.render.width = CORE.Window.screen.width;
3380 CORE.Window.render.height = (int)round((float)CORE.Window.screen.width/displayRatio);
3381 CORE.Window.renderOffset.x = 0;
3382 CORE.Window.renderOffset.y = (CORE.Window.render.height - CORE.Window.screen.height);
3383 }
3384 else
3385 {
3386 CORE.Window.render.width = (int)round((float)CORE.Window.screen.height*displayRatio);
3387 CORE.Window.render.height = CORE.Window.screen.height;
3388 CORE.Window.renderOffset.x = (CORE.Window.render.width - CORE.Window.screen.width);
3389 CORE.Window.renderOffset.y = 0;
3390 }
3391 }
3392 else
3393 {
3394 CORE.Window.render.width = CORE.Window.screen.width;
3395 CORE.Window.render.height = CORE.Window.screen.height;
3396 CORE.Window.renderOffset.x = 0;
3397 CORE.Window.renderOffset.y = 0;
3398 }
3399}
3400
3401// Initialize hi-resolution timer
3402static void InitTimer(void)
3403{
3404 srand((unsigned int)time(NULL)); // Initialize random seed
3405
3406#if !defined(SUPPORT_BUSY_WAIT_LOOP) && defined(_WIN32)
3407 timeBeginPeriod(1); // Setup high-resolution timer to 1ms (granularity of 1-2 ms)
3408#endif
3409
3410#if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID) || defined(PLATFORM_RPI)
3411 struct timespec now;
3412
3413 if (clock_gettime(CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &now) == 0) // Success
3414 {
3415 CORE.Time.base = (unsigned long long int)now.tv_sec*1000000000LLU + (unsigned long long int)now.tv_nsec;
3416 }
3417 else TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "TIMER: Hi-resolution timer not available");
3418#endif
3419
3420 CORE.Time.previous = GetTime(); // Get time as double
3421}
3422
3423// Wait for some milliseconds (stop program execution)
3424// NOTE: Sleep() granularity could be around 10 ms, it means, Sleep() could
3425// take longer than expected... for that reason we use the busy wait loop
3426// Ref: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/43057578/c-programming-win32-games-sleep-taking-longer-than-expected
3427// Ref: http://www.geisswerks.com/ryan/FAQS/timing.html --> All about timming on Win32!
3428static void Wait(float ms)
3429{
3430#if defined(SUPPORT_BUSY_WAIT_LOOP) && !defined(PLATFORM_UWP)
3431 double prevTime = GetTime();
3432 double nextTime = 0.0;
3433
3434 // Busy wait loop
3435 while ((nextTime - prevTime) < ms/1000.0f) nextTime = GetTime();
3436#else
3437 #if defined(SUPPORT_HALFBUSY_WAIT_LOOP)
3438 #define MAX_HALFBUSY_WAIT_TIME 4
3439 double destTime = GetTime() + ms/1000;
3440 if (ms > MAX_HALFBUSY_WAIT_TIME) ms -= MAX_HALFBUSY_WAIT_TIME;
3441 #endif
3442
3443 #if defined(_WIN32)
3444 Sleep((unsigned int)ms);
3445 #elif defined(__linux__) || defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
3446 struct timespec req = { 0 };
3447 time_t sec = (int)(ms/1000.0f);
3448 ms -= (sec*1000);
3449 req.tv_sec = sec;
3450 req.tv_nsec = ms*1000000L;
3451
3452 // NOTE: Use nanosleep() on Unix platforms... usleep() it's deprecated.
3453 while (nanosleep(&req, &req) == -1) continue;
3454 #elif defined(__APPLE__)
3455 usleep(ms*1000.0f);
3456 #endif
3457
3458 #if defined(SUPPORT_HALFBUSY_WAIT_LOOP)
3459 while (GetTime() < destTime) { }
3460 #endif
3461#endif
3462}
3463
3464// Get gamepad button generic to all platforms
3465static int GetGamepadButton(int button)
3466{
3467 int btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_UNKNOWN;
3468#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP)
3469 switch (button)
3470 {
3471 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_Y: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_FACE_UP; break;
3472 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_B: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_FACE_RIGHT; break;
3473 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_A: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_FACE_DOWN; break;
3474 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_X: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_FACE_LEFT; break;
3475
3476 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_BUMPER: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_TRIGGER_1; break;
3477 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_BUMPER: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_TRIGGER_1; break;
3478
3479 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_BACK: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_MIDDLE_LEFT; break;
3480 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_GUIDE: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_MIDDLE; break;
3481 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_START: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_MIDDLE_RIGHT; break;
3482
3483 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_DPAD_UP: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_FACE_UP; break;
3484 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_DPAD_RIGHT: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_FACE_RIGHT; break;
3485 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_DPAD_DOWN: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_FACE_DOWN; break;
3486 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_DPAD_LEFT: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_FACE_LEFT; break;
3487
3488 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_THUMB: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_THUMB; break;
3489 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_THUMB: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_THUMB; break;
3490 }
3491#endif
3492
3493#if defined(PLATFORM_UWP)
3494 btn = button; // UWP will provide the correct button
3495#endif
3496
3497#if defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
3498 // Gamepad Buttons reference: https://www.w3.org/TR/gamepad/#gamepad-interface
3499 switch (button)
3500 {
3501 case 0: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_FACE_DOWN; break;
3502 case 1: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_FACE_RIGHT; break;
3503 case 2: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_FACE_LEFT; break;
3504 case 3: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_FACE_UP; break;
3505 case 4: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_TRIGGER_1; break;
3506 case 5: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_TRIGGER_1; break;
3507 case 6: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_TRIGGER_2; break;
3508 case 7: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_TRIGGER_2; break;
3509 case 8: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_MIDDLE_LEFT; break;
3510 case 9: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_MIDDLE_RIGHT; break;
3511 case 10: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_THUMB; break;
3512 case 11: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_THUMB; break;
3513 case 12: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_FACE_UP; break;
3514 case 13: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_FACE_DOWN; break;
3515 case 14: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_FACE_LEFT; break;
3516 case 15: btn = GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_FACE_RIGHT; break;
3517 }
3518#endif
3519
3520 return btn;
3521}
3522
3523// Get gamepad axis generic to all platforms
3524static int GetGamepadAxis(int axis)
3525{
3526 int axs = GAMEPAD_AXIS_UNKNOWN;
3527#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP)
3528 switch (axis)
3529 {
3530 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_AXIS_LEFT_X: axs = GAMEPAD_AXIS_LEFT_X; break;
3531 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_AXIS_LEFT_Y: axs = GAMEPAD_AXIS_LEFT_Y; break;
3532 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_AXIS_RIGHT_X: axs = GAMEPAD_AXIS_RIGHT_X; break;
3533 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_AXIS_RIGHT_Y: axs = GAMEPAD_AXIS_RIGHT_Y; break;
3534 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_AXIS_LEFT_TRIGGER: axs = GAMEPAD_AXIS_LEFT_TRIGGER; break;
3535 case GLFW_GAMEPAD_AXIS_RIGHT_TRIGGER: axs = GAMEPAD_AXIS_RIGHT_TRIGGER; break;
3536 }
3537#endif
3538
3539#if defined(PLATFORM_UWP)
3540 axs = axis; // UWP will provide the correct axis
3541#endif
3542
3543#if defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
3544 // Gamepad axis reference:https://www.w3.org/TR/gamepad/#gamepad-interface
3545 switch (axis)
3546 {
3547 case 0: axs = GAMEPAD_AXIS_LEFT_X;
3548 case 1: axs = GAMEPAD_AXIS_LEFT_Y;
3549 case 2: axs = GAMEPAD_AXIS_RIGHT_X;
3550 case 3: axs = GAMEPAD_AXIS_RIGHT_X;
3551 }
3552#endif
3553
3554 return axs;
3555}
3556
3557// Poll (store) all input events
3558static void PollInputEvents(void)
3559{
3560#if defined(SUPPORT_GESTURES_SYSTEM)
3561 // NOTE: Gestures update must be called every frame to reset gestures correctly
3562 // because ProcessGestureEvent() is just called on an event, not every frame
3563 UpdateGestures();
3564#endif
3565
3566 // Reset key pressed registered
3567 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount = 0;
3568
3569#if !defined(PLATFORM_RPI)
3570 // Reset last gamepad button/axis registered state
3571 CORE.Input.Gamepad.lastButtonPressed = -1;
3572 CORE.Input.Gamepad.axisCount = 0;
3573#endif
3574
3575#if defined(PLATFORM_RPI)
3576 // Register previous keys states
3577 for (int i = 0; i < 512; i++) CORE.Input.Keyboard.previousKeyState[i] = CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[i];
3578
3579 // Grab a keypress from the evdev fifo if avalable
3580 if (CORE.Input.Keyboard.lastKeyPressed.head != CORE.Input.Keyboard.lastKeyPressed.tail)
3581 {
3582 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueue[CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount] = CORE.Input.Keyboard.lastKeyPressed.contents[CORE.Input.Keyboard.lastKeyPressed.tail]; // Read the key from the buffer
3583 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount++;
3584
3585 CORE.Input.Keyboard.lastKeyPressed.tail = (CORE.Input.Keyboard.lastKeyPressed.tail + 1) & 0x07; // Increment the tail pointer forwards and binary wraparound after 7 (fifo is 8 elements long)
3586 }
3587
3588 // Register previous mouse states
3589 CORE.Input.Mouse.previousWheelMove = CORE.Input.Mouse.currentWheelMove;
3590 CORE.Input.Mouse.currentWheelMove = 0;
3591 for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
3592 {
3593 CORE.Input.Mouse.previousButtonState[i] = CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonState[i];
3594 CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonState[i] = CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonStateEvdev[i];
3595 }
3596#endif
3597
3598#if defined(PLATFORM_UWP)
3599 // Register previous keys states
3600 for (int i = 0; i < 512; i++) CORE.Input.Keyboard.previousKeyState[i] = CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[i];
3601
3602 for (int i = 0; i < MAX_GAMEPADS; i++)
3603 {
3604 if (CORE.Input.Gamepad.ready[i])
3605 {
3606 for (int k = 0; k < MAX_GAMEPAD_BUTTONS; k++) CORE.Input.Gamepad.previousState[i][k] = CORE.Input.Gamepad.currentState[i][k];
3607 }
3608 }
3609
3610 // Register previous mouse states
3611 CORE.Input.Mouse.previousWheelMove = CORE.Input.Mouse.currentWheelMove;
3612 CORE.Input.Mouse.currentWheelMove = 0;
3613
3614 for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) CORE.Input.Mouse.previousButtonState[i] = CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonState[i];
3615
3616 // Loop over pending messages
3617 while (HasMessageFromUWP())
3618 {
3619 UWPMessage *msg = GetMessageFromUWP();
3620
3621 switch (msg->type)
3622 {
3623 case UWP_MSG_REGISTER_KEY:
3624 {
3625 // Convert from virtualKey
3626 int actualKey = -1;
3627
3628 switch (msg->paramInt0)
3629 {
3630 case 0x08: actualKey = KEY_BACKSPACE; break;
3631 case 0x20: actualKey = KEY_SPACE; break;
3632 case 0x1B: actualKey = KEY_ESCAPE; break;
3633 case 0x0D: actualKey = KEY_ENTER; break;
3634 case 0x2E: actualKey = KEY_DELETE; break;
3635 case 0x27: actualKey = KEY_RIGHT; break;
3636 case 0x25: actualKey = KEY_LEFT; break;
3637 case 0x28: actualKey = KEY_DOWN; break;
3638 case 0x26: actualKey = KEY_UP; break;
3639 case 0x70: actualKey = KEY_F1; break;
3640 case 0x71: actualKey = KEY_F2; break;
3641 case 0x72: actualKey = KEY_F3; break;
3642 case 0x73: actualKey = KEY_F4; break;
3643 case 0x74: actualKey = KEY_F5; break;
3644 case 0x75: actualKey = KEY_F6; break;
3645 case 0x76: actualKey = KEY_F7; break;
3646 case 0x77: actualKey = KEY_F8; break;
3647 case 0x78: actualKey = KEY_F9; break;
3648 case 0x79: actualKey = KEY_F10; break;
3649 case 0x7A: actualKey = KEY_F11; break;
3650 case 0x7B: actualKey = KEY_F12; break;
3651 case 0xA0: actualKey = KEY_LEFT_SHIFT; break;
3652 case 0xA2: actualKey = KEY_LEFT_CONTROL; break;
3653 case 0xA4: actualKey = KEY_LEFT_ALT; break;
3654 case 0xA1: actualKey = KEY_RIGHT_SHIFT; break;
3655 case 0xA3: actualKey = KEY_RIGHT_CONTROL; break;
3656 case 0xA5: actualKey = KEY_RIGHT_ALT; break;
3657 case 0x30: actualKey = KEY_ZERO; break;
3658 case 0x31: actualKey = KEY_ONE; break;
3659 case 0x32: actualKey = KEY_TWO; break;
3660 case 0x33: actualKey = KEY_THREE; break;
3661 case 0x34: actualKey = KEY_FOUR; break;
3662 case 0x35: actualKey = KEY_FIVE; break;
3663 case 0x36: actualKey = KEY_SIX; break;
3664 case 0x37: actualKey = KEY_SEVEN; break;
3665 case 0x38: actualKey = KEY_EIGHT; break;
3666 case 0x39: actualKey = KEY_NINE; break;
3667 case 0x41: actualKey = KEY_A; break;
3668 case 0x42: actualKey = KEY_B; break;
3669 case 0x43: actualKey = KEY_C; break;
3670 case 0x44: actualKey = KEY_D; break;
3671 case 0x45: actualKey = KEY_E; break;
3672 case 0x46: actualKey = KEY_F; break;
3673 case 0x47: actualKey = KEY_G; break;
3674 case 0x48: actualKey = KEY_H; break;
3675 case 0x49: actualKey = KEY_I; break;
3676 case 0x4A: actualKey = KEY_J; break;
3677 case 0x4B: actualKey = KEY_K; break;
3678 case 0x4C: actualKey = KEY_L; break;
3679 case 0x4D: actualKey = KEY_M; break;
3680 case 0x4E: actualKey = KEY_N; break;
3681 case 0x4F: actualKey = KEY_O; break;
3682 case 0x50: actualKey = KEY_P; break;
3683 case 0x51: actualKey = KEY_Q; break;
3684 case 0x52: actualKey = KEY_R; break;
3685 case 0x53: actualKey = KEY_S; break;
3686 case 0x54: actualKey = KEY_T; break;
3687 case 0x55: actualKey = KEY_U; break;
3688 case 0x56: actualKey = KEY_V; break;
3689 case 0x57: actualKey = KEY_W; break;
3690 case 0x58: actualKey = KEY_X; break;
3691 case 0x59: actualKey = KEY_Y; break;
3692 case 0x5A: actualKey = KEY_Z; break;
3693 default: break;
3694 }
3695
3696 if (actualKey > -1) CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[actualKey] = msg->paramChar0;
3697
3698 } break;
3699 case UWP_MSG_REGISTER_CLICK: CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonState[msg->paramInt0] = msg->paramChar0; break;
3700 case UWP_MSG_SCROLL_WHEEL_UPDATE: CORE.Input.Mouse.currentWheelMove += msg->paramInt0; break;
3701 case UWP_MSG_UPDATE_MOUSE_LOCATION: CORE.Input.Mouse.position = msg->paramVector0; break;
3702 case UWP_MSG_SET_GAMEPAD_ACTIVE: if (msg->paramInt0 < MAX_GAMEPADS) CORE.Input.Gamepad.ready[msg->paramInt0] = msg->paramBool0; break;
3703 case UWP_MSG_SET_GAMEPAD_BUTTON:
3704 {
3705 if ((msg->paramInt0 < MAX_GAMEPADS) && (msg->paramInt1 < MAX_GAMEPAD_BUTTONS)) CORE.Input.Gamepad.currentState[msg->paramInt0][msg->paramInt1] = msg->paramChar0;
3706 } break;
3707 case UWP_MSG_SET_GAMEPAD_AXIS:
3708 {
3709 if ((msg->paramInt0 < MAX_GAMEPADS) && (msg->paramInt1 < MAX_GAMEPAD_AXIS)) CORE.Input.Gamepad.axisState[msg->paramInt0][msg->paramInt1] = msg->paramFloat0;
3710
3711 // Register buttons for 2nd triggers
3712 CORE.Input.Gamepad.currentState[msg->paramInt0][GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_TRIGGER_2] = (char)(CORE.Input.Gamepad.axisState[msg->paramInt0][GAMEPAD_AXIS_LEFT_TRIGGER] > 0.1);
3713 CORE.Input.Gamepad.currentState[msg->paramInt0][GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_TRIGGER_2] = (char)(CORE.Input.Gamepad.axisState[msg->paramInt0][GAMEPAD_AXIS_RIGHT_TRIGGER] > 0.1);
3714 } break;
3715 case UWP_MSG_SET_DISPLAY_DIMS:
3716 {
3717 CORE.Window.display.width = msg->paramVector0.x;
3718 CORE.Window.display.height = msg->paramVector0.y;
3719 } break;
3720 case UWP_MSG_HANDLE_RESIZE:
3721 {
3722 eglQuerySurface(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.surface, EGL_WIDTH, &CORE.Window.screen.width);
3723 eglQuerySurface(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.surface, EGL_HEIGHT, &CORE.Window.screen.height);
3724
3725 // If window is resized, viewport and projection matrix needs to be re-calculated
3726 rlViewport(0, 0, CORE.Window.screen.width, CORE.Window.screen.height); // Set viewport width and height
3727 rlMatrixMode(RL_PROJECTION); // Switch to PROJECTION matrix
3728 rlLoadIdentity(); // Reset current matrix (PROJECTION)
3729 rlOrtho(0, CORE.Window.screen.width, CORE.Window.screen.height, 0, 0.0f, 1.0f); // Orthographic projection mode with top-left corner at (0,0)
3730 rlMatrixMode(RL_MODELVIEW); // Switch back to MODELVIEW matrix
3731 rlLoadIdentity(); // Reset current matrix (MODELVIEW)
3732 rlClearScreenBuffers(); // Clear screen buffers (color and depth)
3733
3734 // Window size must be updated to be used on 3D mode to get new aspect ratio (BeginMode3D())
3735 // NOTE: Be careful! GLFW3 will choose the closest fullscreen resolution supported by current monitor,
3736 // for example, if reescaling back to 800x450 (desired), it could set 720x480 (closest fullscreen supported)
3737 CORE.Window.currentFbo.width = CORE.Window.screen.width;
3738 CORE.Window.currentFbo.height = CORE.Window.screen.height;
3739
3740 // NOTE: Postprocessing texture is not scaled to new size
3741
3742 CORE.Window.resized = true;
3743
3744 } break;
3745 case UWP_MSG_SET_GAME_TIME: CORE.Time.current = msg->paramDouble0; break;
3746 default: break;
3747 }
3748
3749 DeleteUWPMessage(msg); //Delete, we are done
3750 }
3751#endif // PLATFORM_UWP
3752
3753#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP) || defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
3754 // Keyboard/Mouse input polling (automatically managed by GLFW3 through callback)
3755
3756 // Register previous keys states
3757 for (int i = 0; i < 512; i++) CORE.Input.Keyboard.previousKeyState[i] = CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[i];
3758
3759 // Register previous mouse states
3760 for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) CORE.Input.Mouse.previousButtonState[i] = CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonState[i];
3761
3762 // Register previous mouse wheel state
3763 CORE.Input.Mouse.previousWheelMove = CORE.Input.Mouse.currentWheelMove;
3764 CORE.Input.Mouse.currentWheelMove = 0;
3765#endif
3766
3767 // Register previous touch states
3768 for (int i = 0; i < MAX_TOUCH_POINTS; i++) CORE.Input.Touch.previousTouchState[i] = CORE.Input.Touch.currentTouchState[i];
3769
3770#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP)
3771 // Check if gamepads are ready
3772 // NOTE: We do it here in case of disconnection
3773 for (int i = 0; i < MAX_GAMEPADS; i++)
3774 {
3775 if (glfwJoystickPresent(i)) CORE.Input.Gamepad.ready[i] = true;
3776 else CORE.Input.Gamepad.ready[i] = false;
3777 }
3778
3779 // Register gamepads buttons events
3780 for (int i = 0; i < MAX_GAMEPADS; i++)
3781 {
3782 if (CORE.Input.Gamepad.ready[i]) // Check if gamepad is available
3783 {
3784 // Register previous gamepad states
3785 for (int k = 0; k < MAX_GAMEPAD_BUTTONS; k++) CORE.Input.Gamepad.previousState[i][k] = CORE.Input.Gamepad.currentState[i][k];
3786
3787 // Get current gamepad state
3788 // NOTE: There is no callback available, so we get it manually
3789 // Get remapped buttons
3790 GLFWgamepadstate state;
3791 glfwGetGamepadState(i, &state); // This remapps all gamepads so they have their buttons mapped like an xbox controller
3792 const unsigned char *buttons = state.buttons;
3793
3794 for (int k = 0; (buttons != NULL) && (k < GLFW_GAMEPAD_BUTTON_DPAD_LEFT + 1) && (k < MAX_GAMEPAD_BUTTONS); k++)
3795 {
3796 const GamepadButton button = GetGamepadButton(k);
3797
3798 if (buttons[k] == GLFW_PRESS)
3799 {
3800 CORE.Input.Gamepad.currentState[i][button] = 1;
3801 CORE.Input.Gamepad.lastButtonPressed = button;
3802 }
3803 else CORE.Input.Gamepad.currentState[i][button] = 0;
3804 }
3805
3806 // Get current axis state
3807 const float *axes = state.axes;
3808
3809 for (int k = 0; (axes != NULL) && (k < GLFW_GAMEPAD_AXIS_LAST + 1) && (k < MAX_GAMEPAD_AXIS); k++)
3810 {
3811 const int axis = GetGamepadAxis(k);
3812 CORE.Input.Gamepad.axisState[i][axis] = axes[k];
3813 }
3814
3815 // Register buttons for 2nd triggers (because GLFW doesn't count these as buttons but rather axis)
3816 CORE.Input.Gamepad.currentState[i][GAMEPAD_BUTTON_LEFT_TRIGGER_2] = (char)(CORE.Input.Gamepad.axisState[i][GAMEPAD_AXIS_LEFT_TRIGGER] > 0.1);
3817 CORE.Input.Gamepad.currentState[i][GAMEPAD_BUTTON_RIGHT_TRIGGER_2] = (char)(CORE.Input.Gamepad.axisState[i][GAMEPAD_AXIS_RIGHT_TRIGGER] > 0.1);
3818
3819 CORE.Input.Gamepad.axisCount = GLFW_GAMEPAD_AXIS_LAST;
3820 }
3821 }
3822
3823 CORE.Window.resized = false;
3824
3825#if defined(SUPPORT_EVENTS_WAITING)
3826 glfwWaitEvents();
3827#else
3828 glfwPollEvents(); // Register keyboard/mouse events (callbacks)... and window events!
3829#endif
3830#endif //defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP)
3831
3832// Gamepad support using emscripten API
3833// NOTE: GLFW3 joystick functionality not available in web
3834#if defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
3835 // Get number of gamepads connected
3836 int numGamepads = 0;
3837 if (emscripten_sample_gamepad_data() == EMSCRIPTEN_RESULT_SUCCESS) numGamepads = emscripten_get_num_gamepads();
3838
3839 for (int i = 0; (i < numGamepads) && (i < MAX_GAMEPADS); i++)
3840 {
3841 // Register previous gamepad button states
3842 for (int k = 0; k < MAX_GAMEPAD_BUTTONS; k++) CORE.Input.Gamepad.previousState[i][k] = CORE.Input.Gamepad.currentState[i][k];
3843
3844 EmscriptenGamepadEvent gamepadState;
3845
3846 int result = emscripten_get_gamepad_status(i, &gamepadState);
3847
3848 if (result == EMSCRIPTEN_RESULT_SUCCESS)
3849 {
3850 // Register buttons data for every connected gamepad
3851 for (int j = 0; (j < gamepadState.numButtons) && (j < MAX_GAMEPAD_BUTTONS); j++)
3852 {
3853 const GamepadButton button = GetGamepadButton(j);
3854 if (gamepadState.digitalButton[j] == 1)
3855 {
3856 CORE.Input.Gamepad.currentState[i][button] = 1;
3857 CORE.Input.Gamepad.lastButtonPressed = button;
3858 }
3859 else CORE.Input.Gamepad.currentState[i][button] = 0;
3860
3861 //TRACELOGD("INPUT: Gamepad %d, button %d: Digital: %d, Analog: %g", gamepadState.index, j, gamepadState.digitalButton[j], gamepadState.analogButton[j]);
3862 }
3863
3864 // Register axis data for every connected gamepad
3865 for (int j = 0; (j < gamepadState.numAxes) && (j < MAX_GAMEPAD_AXIS); j++)
3866 {
3867 const int axis = GetGamepadAxis(j);
3868 CORE.Input.Gamepad.axisState[i][axis] = gamepadState.axis[j];
3869 }
3870
3871 CORE.Input.Gamepad.axisCount = gamepadState.numAxes;
3872 }
3873 }
3874#endif
3875
3876#if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID)
3877 // Register previous keys states
3878 // NOTE: Android supports up to 260 keys
3879 for (int i = 0; i < 260; i++) CORE.Input.Keyboard.previousKeyState[i] = CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[i];
3880
3881 // Android ALooper_pollAll() variables
3882 int pollResult = 0;
3883 int pollEvents = 0;
3884
3885 // Poll Events (registered events)
3886 // NOTE: Activity is paused if not enabled (CORE.Android.appEnabled)
3887 while ((pollResult = ALooper_pollAll(CORE.Android.appEnabled? 0 : -1, NULL, &pollEvents, (void**)&CORE.Android.source)) >= 0)
3888 {
3889 // Process this event
3890 if (CORE.Android.source != NULL) CORE.Android.source->process(CORE.Android.app, CORE.Android.source);
3891
3892 // NOTE: Never close window, native activity is controlled by the system!
3893 if (CORE.Android.app->destroyRequested != 0)
3894 {
3895 //CORE.Window.shouldClose = true;
3896 //ANativeActivity_finish(CORE.Android.app->activity);
3897 }
3898 }
3899#endif
3900
3901#if defined(PLATFORM_RPI) && defined(SUPPORT_SSH_KEYBOARD_RPI)
3902 // NOTE: Keyboard reading could be done using input_event(s) reading or just read from stdin,
3903 // we now use both methods inside here. 2nd method is still used for legacy purposes (Allows for input trough SSH console)
3904 ProcessKeyboard();
3905
3906 // NOTE: Mouse input events polling is done asynchronously in another pthread - EventThread()
3907 // NOTE: Gamepad (Joystick) input events polling is done asynchonously in another pthread - GamepadThread()
3908#endif
3909}
3910
3911// Copy back buffer to front buffers
3912static void SwapBuffers(void)
3913{
3914#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP) || defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
3915 glfwSwapBuffers(CORE.Window.handle);
3916#endif
3917
3918#if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID) || defined(PLATFORM_RPI) || defined(PLATFORM_UWP)
3919 eglSwapBuffers(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.surface);
3920#endif
3921}
3922
3923#if defined(PLATFORM_DESKTOP) || defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
3924// GLFW3 Error Callback, runs on GLFW3 error
3925static void ErrorCallback(int error, const char *description)
3926{
3927 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "GLFW: Error: %i Description: %s", error, description);
3928}
3929
3930// GLFW3 Srolling Callback, runs on mouse wheel
3931static void ScrollCallback(GLFWwindow *window, double xoffset, double yoffset)
3932{
3933 CORE.Input.Mouse.currentWheelMove = (int)yoffset;
3934}
3935
3936// GLFW3 Keyboard Callback, runs on key pressed
3937static void KeyCallback(GLFWwindow *window, int key, int scancode, int action, int mods)
3938{
3939 if (key == CORE.Input.Keyboard.exitKey && action == GLFW_PRESS)
3940 {
3941 glfwSetWindowShouldClose(CORE.Window.handle, GLFW_TRUE);
3942
3943 // NOTE: Before closing window, while loop must be left!
3944 }
3945 else if (key == GLFW_KEY_F12 && action == GLFW_PRESS)
3946 {
3947#if defined(SUPPORT_GIF_RECORDING)
3948 if (mods == GLFW_MOD_CONTROL)
3949 {
3950 if (gifRecording)
3951 {
3952 GifEnd();
3953 gifRecording = false;
3954
3955 #if defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
3956 // Download file from MEMFS (emscripten memory filesystem)
3957 // saveFileFromMEMFSToDisk() function is defined in raylib/templates/web_shel/shell.html
3958 emscripten_run_script(TextFormat("saveFileFromMEMFSToDisk('%s','%s')", TextFormat("screenrec%03i.gif", screenshotCounter - 1), TextFormat("screenrec%03i.gif", screenshotCounter - 1)));
3959 #endif
3960
3961 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, "SYSTEM: Finish animated GIF recording");
3962 }
3963 else
3964 {
3965 gifRecording = true;
3966 gifFramesCounter = 0;
3967
3968 char path[512] = { 0 };
3969 #if defined(PLATFORM_ANDROID)
3970 strcpy(path, CORE.Android.internalDataPath);
3971 strcat(path, TextFormat("./screenrec%03i.gif", screenshotCounter));
3972 #else
3973 strcpy(path, TextFormat("./screenrec%03i.gif", screenshotCounter));
3974 #endif
3975
3976 // NOTE: delay represents the time between frames in the gif, if we capture a gif frame every
3977 // 10 game frames and each frame trakes 16.6ms (60fps), delay between gif frames should be ~16.6*10.
3978 GifBegin(path, CORE.Window.screen.width, CORE.Window.screen.height, (int)(GetFrameTime()*10.0f), 8, false);
3979 screenshotCounter++;
3980
3981 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, "SYSTEM: Start animated GIF recording: %s", TextFormat("screenrec%03i.gif", screenshotCounter));
3982 }
3983 }
3984 else
3985#endif // SUPPORT_GIF_RECORDING
3986#if defined(SUPPORT_SCREEN_CAPTURE)
3987 {
3988 TakeScreenshot(TextFormat("screenshot%03i.png", screenshotCounter));
3989 screenshotCounter++;
3990 }
3991#endif // SUPPORT_SCREEN_CAPTURE
3992 }
3993 else
3994 {
3995 // WARNING: GLFW could return GLFW_REPEAT, we need to consider it as 1
3996 // to work properly with our implementation (IsKeyDown/IsKeyUp checks)
3997 if (action == GLFW_RELEASE) CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[key] = 0;
3998 else CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[key] = 1;
3999 }
4000}
4001
4002// GLFW3 Mouse Button Callback, runs on mouse button pressed
4003static void MouseButtonCallback(GLFWwindow *window, int button, int action, int mods)
4004{
4005 // WARNING: GLFW could only return GLFW_PRESS (1) or GLFW_RELEASE (0) for now,
4006 // but future releases may add more actions (i.e. GLFW_REPEAT)
4007 CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonState[button] = action;
4008
4009#if defined(SUPPORT_GESTURES_SYSTEM) && defined(SUPPORT_MOUSE_GESTURES)
4010 // Process mouse events as touches to be able to use mouse-gestures
4011 GestureEvent gestureEvent = { 0 };
4012
4013 // Register touch actions
4014 if ((CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonState[button] == 1) && (CORE.Input.Mouse.previousButtonState[button] == 0)) gestureEvent.touchAction = TOUCH_DOWN;
4015 else if ((CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonState[button] == 0) && (CORE.Input.Mouse.previousButtonState[button] == 1)) gestureEvent.touchAction = TOUCH_UP;
4016
4017 // NOTE: TOUCH_MOVE event is registered in MouseCursorPosCallback()
4018
4019 // Assign a pointer ID
4020 gestureEvent.pointerId[0] = 0;
4021
4022 // Register touch points count
4023 gestureEvent.pointCount = 1;
4024
4025 // Register touch points position, only one point registered
4026 gestureEvent.position[0] = GetMousePosition();
4027
4028 // Normalize gestureEvent.position[0] for CORE.Window.screen.width and CORE.Window.screen.height
4029 gestureEvent.position[0].x /= (float)GetScreenWidth();
4030 gestureEvent.position[0].y /= (float)GetScreenHeight();
4031
4032 // Gesture data is sent to gestures system for processing
4033 ProcessGestureEvent(gestureEvent);
4034#endif
4035}
4036

4038static void MouseCursorPosCallback(GLFWwindow *window, double x, double y)
4039{
4040 CORE.Input.Mouse.position.x = (float)x;
4041 CORE.Input.Mouse.position.y = (float)y;
4042 CORE.Input.Touch.position[0] = CORE.Input.Mouse.position;
4043
4044#if defined(SUPPORT_GESTURES_SYSTEM) && defined(SUPPORT_MOUSE_GESTURES)
4045 // Process mouse events as touches to be able to use mouse-gestures
4046 GestureEvent gestureEvent = { 0 };
4047
4048 gestureEvent.touchAction = TOUCH_MOVE;
4049
4050 // Assign a pointer ID
4051 gestureEvent.pointerId[0] = 0;
4052
4053 // Register touch points count
4054 gestureEvent.pointCount = 1;
4055
4056 // Register touch points position, only one point registered
4057 gestureEvent.position[0] = CORE.Input.Touch.position[0];
4058
4059 // Normalize gestureEvent.position[0] for CORE.Window.screen.width and CORE.Window.screen.height
4060 gestureEvent.position[0].x /= (float)GetScreenWidth();
4061 gestureEvent.position[0].y /= (float)GetScreenHeight();
4062
4063 // Gesture data is sent to gestures system for processing
4064 ProcessGestureEvent(gestureEvent);
4065#endif
4066}

4068// GLFW3 Char Key Callback, runs on key down (get unicode char value)
4069static void CharCallback(GLFWwindow *window, unsigned int key)
4070{
4071 // NOTE: Registers any key down considering OS keyboard layout but
4072 // do not detects action events, those should be managed by user...
4073 // Ref: https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/668#issuecomment-166794907
4074 // Ref: https://www.glfw.org/docs/latest/input_guide.html#input_char
4075
4076 // Check if there is space available in the queue
4077 if (CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount < MAX_CHARS_QUEUE)
4078 {
4079 // Add character to the queue
4080 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueue[CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount] = key;
4081 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount++;
4082 }
4083}

4116// GLFW3 Window Drop Callback, runs when drop files into window
4117// NOTE: Paths are stored in dynamic memory for further retrieval
4118// Everytime new files are dropped, old ones are discarded
4119static void WindowDropCallback(GLFWwindow *window, int count, const char **paths)
4120{
4121 ClearDroppedFiles();
4122
4123 CORE.Window.dropFilesPath = (char **)RL_MALLOC(sizeof(char *)*count);
4124
4125 for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
4126 {
4127 CORE.Window.dropFilesPath[i] = (char *)RL_MALLOC(sizeof(char)*MAX_FILEPATH_LENGTH);
4128 strcpy(CORE.Window.dropFilesPath[i], paths[i]);
4129 }
4130
4131 CORE.Window.dropFilesCount = count;
4132}

4136// ANDROID: Process activity lifecycle commands
4137static void AndroidCommandCallback(struct android_app *app, int32_t cmd)
4138{
4139 switch (cmd)
4140 {
4141 case APP_CMD_START:
4142 {
4143 //rendering = true;
4144 } break;
4145 case APP_CMD_RESUME: break;
4146 case APP_CMD_INIT_WINDOW:
4147 {
4148 if (app->window != NULL)
4149 {
4150 if (CORE.Android.contextRebindRequired)
4151 {
4152 // Reset screen scaling to full display size
4153 EGLint displayFormat;
4154 eglGetConfigAttrib(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.config, EGL_NATIVE_VISUAL_ID, &displayFormat);
4155 ANativeWindow_setBuffersGeometry(app->window, CORE.Window.render.width, CORE.Window.render.height, displayFormat);
4156
4157 // Recreate display surface and re-attach OpenGL context
4158 CORE.Window.surface = eglCreateWindowSurface(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.config, app->window, NULL);
4159 eglMakeCurrent(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.surface, CORE.Window.surface, CORE.Window.context);
4160
4161 CORE.Android.contextRebindRequired = false;
4162 }
4163 else
4164 {
4165 CORE.Window.display.width = ANativeWindow_getWidth(CORE.Android.app->window);
4166 CORE.Window.display.height = ANativeWindow_getHeight(CORE.Android.app->window);
4167
4168 // Init graphics device (display device and OpenGL context)
4169 InitGraphicsDevice(CORE.Window.screen.width, CORE.Window.screen.height);
4170
4171 // Init hi-res timer
4172 InitTimer();
4173
4174 #if defined(SUPPORT_DEFAULT_FONT)
4175 // Load default font
4176 // NOTE: External function (defined in module: text)
4177 LoadFontDefault();
4178 Rectangle rec = GetFontDefault().recs[95];
4179 // NOTE: We setup a 1px padding on char rectangle to avoid pixel bleeding on MSAA filtering
4180 SetShapesTexture(GetFontDefault().texture, (Rectangle){ rec.x + 1, rec.y + 1, rec.width - 2, rec.height - 2 });
4181 #endif
4182
4183 // TODO: GPU assets reload in case of lost focus (lost context)
4184 // NOTE: This problem has been solved just unbinding and rebinding context from display
4185 /*
4186 if (assetsReloadRequired)
4187 {
4188 for (int i = 0; i < assetsCount; i++)
4189 {
4190 // TODO: Unload old asset if required
4191
4192 // Load texture again to pointed texture
4193 (*textureAsset + i) = LoadTexture(assetPath[i]);
4194 }
4195 }
4196 */
4197 }
4198 }
4199 } break;
4200 case APP_CMD_GAINED_FOCUS:
4201 {
4202 CORE.Android.appEnabled = true;
4203 //ResumeMusicStream();
4204 } break;
4205 case APP_CMD_PAUSE: break;
4206 case APP_CMD_LOST_FOCUS:
4207 {
4208 CORE.Android.appEnabled = false;
4209 //PauseMusicStream();
4210 } break;
4211 case APP_CMD_TERM_WINDOW:
4212 {
4213 // Dettach OpenGL context and destroy display surface
4214 // NOTE 1: Detaching context before destroying display surface avoids losing our resources (textures, shaders, VBOs...)
4215 // NOTE 2: In some cases (too many context loaded), OS could unload context automatically... :(
4216 eglMakeCurrent(CORE.Window.device, EGL_NO_SURFACE, EGL_NO_SURFACE, EGL_NO_CONTEXT);
4217 eglDestroySurface(CORE.Window.device, CORE.Window.surface);
4218
4219 CORE.Android.contextRebindRequired = true;
4220 } break;
4221 case APP_CMD_SAVE_STATE: break;
4222 case APP_CMD_STOP: break;
4223 case APP_CMD_DESTROY:
4224 {
4225 // TODO: Finish activity?
4226 //ANativeActivity_finish(CORE.Android.app->activity);
4227 } break;
4228 case APP_CMD_CONFIG_CHANGED:
4229 {
4230 //AConfiguration_fromAssetManager(CORE.Android.app->config, CORE.Android.app->activity->assetManager);
4231 //print_cur_config(CORE.Android.app);
4232
4233 // Check screen orientation here!
4234 } break;
4235 default: break;
4236 }
4237}
4238
4239// ANDROID: Get input events
4240static int32_t AndroidInputCallback(struct android_app *app, AInputEvent *event)
4241{
4242 // If additional inputs are required check:
4243 // https://developer.android.com/ndk/reference/group/input
4244 // https://developer.android.com/training/game-controllers/controller-input
4245
4246 int type = AInputEvent_getType(event);
4247 int source = AInputEvent_getSource(event);
4248
4249 if (type == AINPUT_EVENT_TYPE_MOTION)
4250 {
4251 if ((source & AINPUT_SOURCE_JOYSTICK) == AINPUT_SOURCE_JOYSTICK || (source & AINPUT_SOURCE_GAMEPAD) == AINPUT_SOURCE_GAMEPAD)
4252 {
4253 // Get first touch position
4254 CORE.Input.Touch.position[0].x = AMotionEvent_getX(event, 0);
4255 CORE.Input.Touch.position[0].y = AMotionEvent_getY(event, 0);
4256
4257 // Get second touch position
4258 CORE.Input.Touch.position[1].x = AMotionEvent_getX(event, 1);
4259 CORE.Input.Touch.position[1].y = AMotionEvent_getY(event, 1);
4260
4261 int32_t keycode = AKeyEvent_getKeyCode(event);
4262 if (AKeyEvent_getAction(event) == AKEY_EVENT_ACTION_DOWN)
4263 {
4264 CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[keycode] = 1; // Key down
4265
4266 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueue[CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount] = keycode;
4267 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount++;
4268 }
4269 else CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[keycode] = 0; // Key up
4270
4271 // Stop processing gamepad buttons
4272 return 1;
4273 }
4274 }
4275 else if (type == AINPUT_EVENT_TYPE_KEY)
4276 {
4277 int32_t keycode = AKeyEvent_getKeyCode(event);
4278 //int32_t AKeyEvent_getMetaState(event);
4279
4280 // Save current button and its state
4281 // NOTE: Android key action is 0 for down and 1 for up
4282 if (AKeyEvent_getAction(event) == AKEY_EVENT_ACTION_DOWN)
4283 {
4284 CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[keycode] = 1; // Key down
4285
4286 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueue[CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount] = keycode;
4287 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount++;
4288 }
4289 else CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[keycode] = 0; // Key up
4290
4291 if (keycode == AKEYCODE_POWER)
4292 {
4293 // Let the OS handle input to avoid app stuck. Behaviour: CMD_PAUSE -> CMD_SAVE_STATE -> CMD_STOP -> CMD_CONFIG_CHANGED -> CMD_LOST_FOCUS
4294 // Resuming Behaviour: CMD_START -> CMD_RESUME -> CMD_CONFIG_CHANGED -> CMD_CONFIG_CHANGED -> CMD_GAINED_FOCUS
4295 // It seems like locking mobile, screen size (CMD_CONFIG_CHANGED) is affected.
4296 // NOTE: AndroidManifest.xml must have <activity android:configChanges="orientation|keyboardHidden|screenSize" >
4297 // Before that change, activity was calling CMD_TERM_WINDOW and CMD_DESTROY when locking mobile, so that was not a normal behaviour
4298 return 0;
4299 }
4300 else if ((keycode == AKEYCODE_BACK) || (keycode == AKEYCODE_MENU))
4301 {
4302 // Eat BACK_BUTTON and AKEYCODE_MENU, just do nothing... and don't let to be handled by OS!
4303 return 1;
4304 }
4305 else if ((keycode == AKEYCODE_VOLUME_UP) || (keycode == AKEYCODE_VOLUME_DOWN))
4306 {
4307 // Set default OS behaviour
4308 return 0;
4309 }
4310
4311 return 0;
4312 }
4313
4314 CORE.Input.Touch.position[0].x = AMotionEvent_getX(event, 0);
4315 CORE.Input.Touch.position[0].y = AMotionEvent_getY(event, 0);
4316
4317 int32_t action = AMotionEvent_getAction(event);
4318 unsigned int flags = action & AMOTION_EVENT_ACTION_MASK;
4319
4320 if (flags == AMOTION_EVENT_ACTION_DOWN || flags == AMOTION_EVENT_ACTION_MOVE)
4321 {
4322 CORE.Input.Touch.currentTouchState[MOUSE_LEFT_BUTTON] = 1;
4323 }
4324 else if (flags == AMOTION_EVENT_ACTION_UP)
4325 {
4326 CORE.Input.Touch.currentTouchState[MOUSE_LEFT_BUTTON] = 0;
4327 }
4328
4329#if defined(SUPPORT_GESTURES_SYSTEM)
4330
4331 GestureEvent gestureEvent;
4332
4333 // Register touch actions
4334 if (flags == AMOTION_EVENT_ACTION_DOWN) gestureEvent.touchAction = TOUCH_DOWN;
4335 else if (flags == AMOTION_EVENT_ACTION_UP) gestureEvent.touchAction = TOUCH_UP;
4336 else if (flags == AMOTION_EVENT_ACTION_MOVE) gestureEvent.touchAction = TOUCH_MOVE;
4337
4338 // Register touch points count
4339 // NOTE: Documentation says pointerCount is Always >= 1,
4340 // but in practice it can be 0 or over a million
4341 gestureEvent.pointCount = AMotionEvent_getPointerCount(event);
4342
4343 // Only enable gestures for 1-3 touch points
4344 if ((gestureEvent.pointCount > 0) && (gestureEvent.pointCount < 4))
4345 {
4346 // Register touch points id
4347 // NOTE: Only two points registered
4348 gestureEvent.pointerId[0] = AMotionEvent_getPointerId(event, 0);
4349 gestureEvent.pointerId[1] = AMotionEvent_getPointerId(event, 1);
4350
4351 // Register touch points position
4352 gestureEvent.position[0] = (Vector2){ AMotionEvent_getX(event, 0), AMotionEvent_getY(event, 0) };
4353 gestureEvent.position[1] = (Vector2){ AMotionEvent_getX(event, 1), AMotionEvent_getY(event, 1) };
4354
4355 // Normalize gestureEvent.position[x] for screenWidth and screenHeight
4356 gestureEvent.position[0].x /= (float)GetScreenWidth();
4357 gestureEvent.position[0].y /= (float)GetScreenHeight();
4358
4359 gestureEvent.position[1].x /= (float)GetScreenWidth();
4360 gestureEvent.position[1].y /= (float)GetScreenHeight();
4361
4362 // Gesture data is sent to gestures system for processing
4363 ProcessGestureEvent(gestureEvent);
4364 }
4365#endif
4366
4367 return 0;
4368}
4369#endif
4370
4371#if defined(PLATFORM_WEB)
4372// Register fullscreen change events
4373static EM_BOOL EmscriptenFullscreenChangeCallback(int eventType, const EmscriptenFullscreenChangeEvent *event, void *userData)
4374{
4375 //isFullscreen: int event->isFullscreen
4376 //fullscreenEnabled: int event->fullscreenEnabled
4377 //fs element nodeName: (char *) event->nodeName
4378 //fs element id: (char *) event->id
4379 //Current element size: (int) event->elementWidth, (int) event->elementHeight
4380 //Screen size:(int) event->screenWidth, (int) event->screenHeight
4381
4382 if (event->isFullscreen)
4383 {
4384 CORE.Window.fullscreen = true;
4385 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, "WEB: Canvas scaled to fullscreen. ElementSize: (%ix%i), ScreenSize(%ix%i)", event->elementWidth, event->elementHeight, event->screenWidth, event->screenHeight);
4386 }
4387 else
4388 {
4389 CORE.Window.fullscreen = false;
4390 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, "WEB: Canvas scaled to windowed. ElementSize: (%ix%i), ScreenSize(%ix%i)", event->elementWidth, event->elementHeight, event->screenWidth, event->screenHeight);
4391 }
4392
4393 // TODO: Depending on scaling factor (screen vs element), calculate factor to scale mouse/touch input
4394
4395 return 0;
4396}
