4409// Register mouse input events
4410static EM_BOOL EmscriptenMouseCallback(int eventType, const EmscriptenMouseEvent *mouseEvent, void *userData)
4411{
4412 // Lock mouse pointer when click on screen
4413 if ((eventType == EMSCRIPTEN_EVENT_CLICK) && CORE.Input.Mouse.cursorLockRequired)
4414 {
4415 EmscriptenPointerlockChangeEvent plce;
4416 emscripten_get_pointerlock_status(&plce);
4417
4418 if (!plce.isActive) emscripten_request_pointerlock(0, 1);
4419 else
4420 {
4421 emscripten_exit_pointerlock();
4422 emscripten_get_pointerlock_status(&plce);
4423 //if (plce.isActive) TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "Pointer lock exit did not work!");
4424 }
4425
4426 CORE.Input.Mouse.cursorLockRequired = false;
4427 }
4428
4429 return 0;
4430}
4431
4432// Register touch input events
4433static EM_BOOL EmscriptenTouchCallback(int eventType, const EmscriptenTouchEvent *touchEvent, void *userData)
4434{
4435 for (int i = 0; i < touchEvent->numTouches; i++)
4436 {
4437 if (eventType == EMSCRIPTEN_EVENT_TOUCHSTART) CORE.Input.Touch.currentTouchState[i] = 1;
4438 else if (eventType == EMSCRIPTEN_EVENT_TOUCHEND) CORE.Input.Touch.currentTouchState[i] = 0;
4439 }
4440
4441#if defined(SUPPORT_GESTURES_SYSTEM)
4442 GestureEvent gestureEvent = { 0 };
4443
4444 // Register touch actions
4445 if (eventType == EMSCRIPTEN_EVENT_TOUCHSTART) gestureEvent.touchAction = TOUCH_DOWN;
4446 else if (eventType == EMSCRIPTEN_EVENT_TOUCHEND) gestureEvent.touchAction = TOUCH_UP;
4447 else if (eventType == EMSCRIPTEN_EVENT_TOUCHMOVE) gestureEvent.touchAction = TOUCH_MOVE;
4448
4449 // Register touch points count
4450 gestureEvent.pointCount = touchEvent->numTouches;
4451
4452 // Register touch points id
4453 gestureEvent.pointerId[0] = touchEvent->touches[0].identifier;
4454 gestureEvent.pointerId[1] = touchEvent->touches[1].identifier;
4455
4456 // Register touch points position
4457 // NOTE: Only two points registered
4458 gestureEvent.position[0] = (Vector2){ touchEvent->touches[0].targetX, touchEvent->touches[0].targetY };
4459 gestureEvent.position[1] = (Vector2){ touchEvent->touches[1].targetX, touchEvent->touches[1].targetY };
4460
4461 double canvasWidth, canvasHeight;
4462 // NOTE: emscripten_get_canvas_element_size() returns canvas.width and canvas.height but
4463 // we are looking for actual CSS size: canvas.style.width and canvas.style.height
4464 //EMSCRIPTEN_RESULT res = emscripten_get_canvas_element_size("#canvas", &canvasWidth, &canvasHeight);
4465 emscripten_get_element_css_size("#canvas", &canvasWidth, &canvasHeight);
4466
4467 // Normalize gestureEvent.position[x] for CORE.Window.screen.width and CORE.Window.screen.height
4468 gestureEvent.position[0].x *= ((float)GetScreenWidth()/(float)canvasWidth);
4469 gestureEvent.position[0].y *= ((float)GetScreenHeight()/(float)canvasHeight);
4470 gestureEvent.position[1].x *= ((float)GetScreenWidth()/(float)canvasWidth);
4471 gestureEvent.position[1].y *= ((float)GetScreenHeight()/(float)canvasHeight);
4472
4473 CORE.Input.Touch.position[0] = gestureEvent.position[0];
4474 CORE.Input.Touch.position[1] = gestureEvent.position[1];
4475
4476 // Gesture data is sent to gestures system for processing
4477 ProcessGestureEvent(gestureEvent);
4478#else
4479 // Support only simple touch position
4480 if (eventType == EMSCRIPTEN_EVENT_TOUCHSTART)
4481 {
4482 // Get first touch position
4483 CORE.Input.Touch.position[0] = (Vector2){ touchEvent->touches[0].targetX, touchEvent->touches[0].targetY };
4484
4485 double canvasWidth, canvasHeight;
4486 //EMSCRIPTEN_RESULT res = emscripten_get_canvas_element_size("#canvas", &canvasWidth, &canvasHeight);
4487 emscripten_get_element_css_size("#canvas", &canvasWidth, &canvasHeight);
4488
4489 // Normalize gestureEvent.position[x] for screenWidth and screenHeight
4490 CORE.Input.Touch.position[0].x *= ((float)GetScreenWidth()/(float)canvasWidth);
4491 CORE.Input.Touch.position[0].y *= ((float)GetScreenHeight()/(float)canvasHeight);
4492 }
4493#endif
4494
4495 return 1;
4496}

4498// Register connected/disconnected gamepads events
4499static EM_BOOL EmscriptenGamepadCallback(int eventType, const EmscriptenGamepadEvent *gamepadEvent, void *userData)
4500{
4501 /*
4502 TRACELOGD("%s: timeStamp: %g, connected: %d, index: %ld, numAxes: %d, numButtons: %d, id: \"%s\", mapping: \"%s\"",
4503 eventType != 0? emscripten_event_type_to_string(eventType) : "Gamepad state",
4504 gamepadEvent->timestamp, gamepadEvent->connected, gamepadEvent->index, gamepadEvent->numAxes, gamepadEvent->numButtons, gamepadEvent->id, gamepadEvent->mapping);
4505
4506 for (int i = 0; i < gamepadEvent->numAxes; ++i) TRACELOGD("Axis %d: %g", i, gamepadEvent->axis[i]);
4507 for (int i = 0; i < gamepadEvent->numButtons; ++i) TRACELOGD("Button %d: Digital: %d, Analog: %g", i, gamepadEvent->digitalButton[i], gamepadEvent->analogButton[i]);
4508 */
4509
4510 if ((gamepadEvent->connected) && (gamepadEvent->index < MAX_GAMEPADS)) CORE.Input.Gamepad.ready[gamepadEvent->index] = true;
4511 else CORE.Input.Gamepad.ready[gamepadEvent->index] = false;
4512
4513 // TODO: Test gamepadEvent->index
4514
4515 return 0;
4516}
4517#endif
4518
4519#if defined(PLATFORM_RPI)
4520
4521#if defined(SUPPORT_SSH_KEYBOARD_RPI)
4522// Initialize Keyboard system (using standard input)
4523static void InitKeyboard(void)
4524{
4525 // NOTE: We read directly from Standard Input (stdin) - STDIN_FILENO file descriptor
4526
4527 // Make stdin non-blocking (not enough, need to configure to non-canonical mode)
4528 int flags = fcntl(STDIN_FILENO, F_GETFL, 0); // F_GETFL: Get the file access mode and the file status flags
4529 fcntl(STDIN_FILENO, F_SETFL, flags | O_NONBLOCK); // F_SETFL: Set the file status flags to the value specified
4530
4531 // Save terminal keyboard settings and reconfigure terminal with new settings
4532 struct termios keyboardNewSettings;
4533 tcgetattr(STDIN_FILENO, &CORE.Input.Keyboard.defaultSettings); // Get current keyboard settings
4534 keyboardNewSettings = CORE.Input.Keyboard.defaultSettings;
4535
4536 // New terminal settings for keyboard: turn off buffering (non-canonical mode), echo and key processing
4537 // NOTE: ISIG controls if ^C and ^Z generate break signals or not
4538 keyboardNewSettings.c_lflag &= ~(ICANON | ECHO | ISIG);
4539 //keyboardNewSettings.c_iflag &= ~(ISTRIP | INLCR | ICRNL | IGNCR | IXON | IXOFF);
4540 keyboardNewSettings.c_cc[VMIN] = 1;
4541 keyboardNewSettings.c_cc[VTIME] = 0;
4542
4543 // Set new keyboard settings (change occurs immediately)
4544 tcsetattr(STDIN_FILENO, TCSANOW, &keyboardNewSettings);
4545
4546 // NOTE: Reading directly from stdin will give chars already key-mapped by kernel to ASCII or UNICODE
4547
4548 // Save old keyboard mode to restore it at the end
4549 if (ioctl(STDIN_FILENO, KDGKBMODE, &CORE.Input.Keyboard.defaultMode) < 0)
4550 {
4551 // NOTE: It could mean we are using a remote keyboard through ssh!
4552 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "RPI: Failed to change keyboard mode (SSH keyboard?)");
4553 }
4554 else
4555 {
4556 // We reconfigure keyboard mode to get:
4557 // - scancodes (K_RAW)
4558 // - keycodes (K_MEDIUMRAW)
4559 // - ASCII chars (K_XLATE)
4560 // - UNICODE chars (K_UNICODE)
4561 ioctl(STDIN_FILENO, KDSKBMODE, K_XLATE);
4562 }
4563
4564 // Register keyboard restore when program finishes
4565 atexit(RestoreKeyboard);
4566}
4567
4568// Process keyboard inputs
4569// TODO: Most probably input reading and processing should be in a separate thread
4570static void ProcessKeyboard(void)
4571{
4572 #define MAX_KEYBUFFER_SIZE 32 // Max size in bytes to read
4573
4574 // Keyboard input polling (fill keys[256] array with status)
4575 int bufferByteCount = 0; // Bytes available on the buffer
4576 char keysBuffer[MAX_KEYBUFFER_SIZE]; // Max keys to be read at a time
4577
4578 // Read availables keycodes from stdin
4579 bufferByteCount = read(STDIN_FILENO, keysBuffer, MAX_KEYBUFFER_SIZE); // POSIX system call
4580
4581 // Reset pressed keys array (it will be filled below)
4582 for (int i = 0; i < 512; i++) CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[i] = 0;
4583
4584 // Check keys from event input workers (This is the new keyboard reading method)
4585 //for (int i = 0; i < 512; i++) CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[i] = CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyStateEvdev[i];
4586
4587 // Fill all read bytes (looking for keys)
4588 for (int i = 0; i < bufferByteCount; i++)
4589 {
4590 // NOTE: If (key == 0x1b), depending on next key, it could be a special keymap code!
4591 // Up -> 1b 5b 41 / Left -> 1b 5b 44 / Right -> 1b 5b 43 / Down -> 1b 5b 42
4592 if (keysBuffer[i] == 0x1b)
4593 {
4594 // Detect ESC to stop program
4595 if (bufferByteCount == 1) CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[CORE.Input.Keyboard.exitKey] = 1;
4596 else
4597 {
4598 if (keysBuffer[i + 1] == 0x5b) // Special function key
4599 {
4600 if ((keysBuffer[i + 2] == 0x5b) || (keysBuffer[i + 2] == 0x31) || (keysBuffer[i + 2] == 0x32))
4601 {
4602 // Process special function keys (F1 - F12)
4603 switch (keysBuffer[i + 3])
4604 {
4605 case 0x41: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[290] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_F1
4606 case 0x42: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[291] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_F2
4607 case 0x43: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[292] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_F3
4608 case 0x44: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[293] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_F4
4609 case 0x45: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[294] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_F5
4610 case 0x37: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[295] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_F6
4611 case 0x38: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[296] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_F7
4612 case 0x39: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[297] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_F8
4613 case 0x30: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[298] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_F9
4614 case 0x31: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[299] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_F10
4615 case 0x33: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[300] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_F11
4616 case 0x34: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[301] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_F12
4617 default: break;
4618 }
4619
4620 if (keysBuffer[i + 2] == 0x5b) i += 4;
4621 else if ((keysBuffer[i + 2] == 0x31) || (keysBuffer[i + 2] == 0x32)) i += 5;
4622 }
4623 else
4624 {
4625 switch (keysBuffer[i + 2])
4626 {
4627 case 0x41: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[265] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_UP
4628 case 0x42: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[264] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_DOWN
4629 case 0x43: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[262] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_RIGHT
4630 case 0x44: CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[263] = 1; break; // raylib KEY_LEFT
4631 default: break;
4632 }
4633
4634 i += 3; // Jump to next key
4635 }
4636
4637 // NOTE: Some keys are not directly keymapped (CTRL, ALT, SHIFT)
4638 }
4639 }
4640 }
4641 else if (keysBuffer[i] == 0x0a) // raylib KEY_ENTER (don't mix with <linux/input.h> KEY_*)
4642 {
4643 CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[257] = 1;
4644
4645 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueue[CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount] = 257; // Add keys pressed into queue
4646 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount++;
4647 }
4648 else if (keysBuffer[i] == 0x7f) // raylib KEY_BACKSPACE
4649 {
4650 CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[259] = 1;
4651
4652 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueue[CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount] = 257; // Add keys pressed into queue
4653 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount++;
4654 }
4655 else
4656 {
4657 // Translate lowercase a-z letters to A-Z
4658 if ((keysBuffer[i] >= 97) && (keysBuffer[i] <= 122))
4659 {
4660 CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[(int)keysBuffer[i] - 32] = 1;
4661 }
4662 else CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[(int)keysBuffer[i]] = 1;
4663
4664 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueue[CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount] = keysBuffer[i]; // Add keys pressed into queue
4665 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount++;
4666 }
4667 }
4668
4669 // Check exit key (same functionality as GLFW3 KeyCallback())
4670 if (CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[CORE.Input.Keyboard.exitKey] == 1) CORE.Window.shouldClose = true;
4671
4672#if defined(SUPPORT_SCREEN_CAPTURE)
4673 // Check screen capture key (raylib key: KEY_F12)
4674 if (CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[301] == 1)
4675 {
4676 TakeScreenshot(FormatText("screenshot%03i.png", screenshotCounter));
4677 screenshotCounter++;
4678 }
4679#endif
4680}
4681
4682// Restore default keyboard input
4683static void RestoreKeyboard(void)
4684{
4685 // Reset to default keyboard settings
4686 tcsetattr(STDIN_FILENO, TCSANOW, &CORE.Input.Keyboard.defaultSettings);
4687
4688 // Reconfigure keyboard to default mode
4689 ioctl(STDIN_FILENO, KDSKBMODE, CORE.Input.Keyboard.defaultMode);
4690}
4691#endif //SUPPORT_SSH_KEYBOARD_RPI
4692
4693// Initialise user input from evdev(/dev/input/event<N>) this means mouse, keyboard or gamepad devices
4694static void InitEvdevInput(void)
4695{
4696 char path[MAX_FILEPATH_LENGTH];
4697 DIR *directory;
4698 struct dirent *entity;
4699
4700 // Reset variables
4701 for (int i = 0; i < MAX_TOUCH_POINTS; ++i)
4702 {
4703 CORE.Input.Touch.position[i].x = -1;
4704 CORE.Input.Touch.position[i].y = -1;
4705 }
4706
4707 // Reset keypress buffer
4708 CORE.Input.Keyboard.lastKeyPressed.head = 0;
4709 CORE.Input.Keyboard.lastKeyPressed.tail = 0;
4710
4711 // Reset keyboard key state
4712 for (int i = 0; i < 512; i++) CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[i] = 0;
4713
4714 // Open the linux directory of "/dev/input"
4715 directory = opendir(DEFAULT_EVDEV_PATH);
4716
4717 if (directory)
4718 {
4719 while ((entity = readdir(directory)) != NULL)
4720 {
4721 if (strncmp("event", entity->d_name, strlen("event")) == 0) // Search for devices named "event*"
4722 {
4723 sprintf(path, "%s%s", DEFAULT_EVDEV_PATH, entity->d_name);
4724 EventThreadSpawn(path); // Identify the device and spawn a thread for it
4725 }
4726 }
4727
4728 closedir(directory);
4729 }
4730 else TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "RPI: Failed to open linux event directory: %s", DEFAULT_EVDEV_PATH);
4731}
4732
4733// Identifies a input device and spawns a thread to handle it if needed
4734static void EventThreadSpawn(char *device)
4735{
4736 #define BITS_PER_LONG (sizeof(long)*8)
4737 #define NBITS(x) ((((x) - 1)/BITS_PER_LONG) + 1)
4738 #define OFF(x) ((x)%BITS_PER_LONG)
4739 #define BIT(x) (1UL<<OFF(x))
4740 #define LONG(x) ((x)/BITS_PER_LONG)
4741 #define TEST_BIT(array, bit) ((array[LONG(bit)] >> OFF(bit)) & 1)
4742
4743 struct input_absinfo absinfo;
4744 unsigned long evBits[NBITS(EV_MAX)];
4745 unsigned long absBits[NBITS(ABS_MAX)];
4746 unsigned long relBits[NBITS(REL_MAX)];
4747 unsigned long keyBits[NBITS(KEY_MAX)];
4748 bool hasAbs = false;
4749 bool hasRel = false;
4750 bool hasAbsMulti = false;
4751 int freeWorkerId = -1;
4752 int fd = -1;
4753
4754 InputEventWorker *worker;
4755
4756 // Open the device and allocate worker
4757 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4758 // Find a free spot in the workers array
4759 for (int i = 0; i < sizeof(CORE.Input.eventWorker)/sizeof(InputEventWorker); ++i)
4760 {
4761 if (CORE.Input.eventWorker[i].threadId == 0)
4762 {
4763 freeWorkerId = i;
4764 break;
4765 }
4766 }
4767
4768 // Select the free worker from array
4769 if (freeWorkerId >= 0)
4770 {
4771 worker = &(CORE.Input.eventWorker[freeWorkerId]); // Grab a pointer to the worker
4772 memset(worker, 0, sizeof(InputEventWorker)); // Clear the worker
4773 }
4774 else
4775 {
4776 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "RPI: Failed to create input device thread for %s, out of worker slots", device);
4777 return;
4778 }
4779
4780 // Open the device
4781 fd = open(device, O_RDONLY | O_NONBLOCK);
4782 if (fd < 0)
4783 {
4784 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "RPI: Failed to open input device (error: %d)", device, worker->fd);
4785 return;
4786 }
4787 worker->fd = fd;
4788
4789 // Grab number on the end of the devices name "event<N>"
4790 int devNum = 0;
4791 char *ptrDevName = strrchr(device, 't');
4792 worker->eventNum = -1;
4793
4794 if (ptrDevName != NULL)
4795 {
4796 if (sscanf(ptrDevName, "t%d", &devNum) == 1)
4797 worker->eventNum = devNum;
4798 }
4799
4800 // At this point we have a connection to the device, but we don't yet know what the device is.
4801 // It could be many things, even as simple as a power button...
4802 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4803
4804 // Identify the device
4805 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4806 ioctl(fd, EVIOCGBIT(0, sizeof(evBits)), evBits); // Read a bitfield of the avalable device properties
4807
4808 // Check for absolute input devices
4809 if (TEST_BIT(evBits, EV_ABS))
4810 {
4811 ioctl(fd, EVIOCGBIT(EV_ABS, sizeof(absBits)), absBits);
4812
4813 // Check for absolute movement support (usualy touchscreens, but also joysticks)
4814 if (TEST_BIT(absBits, ABS_X) && TEST_BIT(absBits, ABS_Y))
4815 {
4816 hasAbs = true;
4817
4818 // Get the scaling values
4819 ioctl(fd, EVIOCGABS(ABS_X), &absinfo);
4820 worker->absRange.x = absinfo.minimum;
4821 worker->absRange.width = absinfo.maximum - absinfo.minimum;
4822 ioctl(fd, EVIOCGABS(ABS_Y), &absinfo);
4823 worker->absRange.y = absinfo.minimum;
4824 worker->absRange.height = absinfo.maximum - absinfo.minimum;
4825 }
4826
4827 // Check for multiple absolute movement support (usualy multitouch touchscreens)
4828 if (TEST_BIT(absBits, ABS_MT_POSITION_X) && TEST_BIT(absBits, ABS_MT_POSITION_Y))
4829 {
4830 hasAbsMulti = true;
4831
4832 // Get the scaling values
4833 ioctl(fd, EVIOCGABS(ABS_X), &absinfo);
4834 worker->absRange.x = absinfo.minimum;
4835 worker->absRange.width = absinfo.maximum - absinfo.minimum;
4836 ioctl(fd, EVIOCGABS(ABS_Y), &absinfo);
4837 worker->absRange.y = absinfo.minimum;
4838 worker->absRange.height = absinfo.maximum - absinfo.minimum;
4839 }
4840 }
4841
4842 // Check for relative movement support (usualy mouse)
4843 if (TEST_BIT(evBits, EV_REL))
4844 {
4845 ioctl(fd, EVIOCGBIT(EV_REL, sizeof(relBits)), relBits);
4846
4847 if (TEST_BIT(relBits, REL_X) && TEST_BIT(relBits, REL_Y)) hasRel = true;
4848 }
4849
4850 // Check for button support to determine the device type(usualy on all input devices)
4851 if (TEST_BIT(evBits, EV_KEY))
4852 {
4853 ioctl(fd, EVIOCGBIT(EV_KEY, sizeof(keyBits)), keyBits);
4854
4855 if (hasAbs || hasAbsMulti)
4856 {
4857 if (TEST_BIT(keyBits, BTN_TOUCH)) worker->isTouch = true; // This is a touchscreen
4858 if (TEST_BIT(keyBits, BTN_TOOL_FINGER)) worker->isTouch = true; // This is a drawing tablet
4859 if (TEST_BIT(keyBits, BTN_TOOL_PEN)) worker->isTouch = true; // This is a drawing tablet
4860 if (TEST_BIT(keyBits, BTN_STYLUS)) worker->isTouch = true; // This is a drawing tablet
4861 if (worker->isTouch || hasAbsMulti) worker->isMultitouch = true; // This is a multitouch capable device
4862 }
4863
4864 if (hasRel)
4865 {
4866 if (TEST_BIT(keyBits, BTN_LEFT)) worker->isMouse = true; // This is a mouse
4867 if (TEST_BIT(keyBits, BTN_RIGHT)) worker->isMouse = true; // This is a mouse
4868 }
4869
4870 if (TEST_BIT(keyBits, BTN_A)) worker->isGamepad = true; // This is a gamepad
4871 if (TEST_BIT(keyBits, BTN_TRIGGER)) worker->isGamepad = true; // This is a gamepad
4872 if (TEST_BIT(keyBits, BTN_START)) worker->isGamepad = true; // This is a gamepad
4873 if (TEST_BIT(keyBits, BTN_TL)) worker->isGamepad = true; // This is a gamepad
4874 if (TEST_BIT(keyBits, BTN_TL)) worker->isGamepad = true; // This is a gamepad
4875
4876 if (TEST_BIT(keyBits, KEY_SPACE)) worker->isKeyboard = true; // This is a keyboard
4877 }
4878 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4879
4880 // Decide what to do with the device
4881 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4882 if (worker->isTouch || worker->isMouse || worker->isKeyboard)
4883 {
4884 // Looks like an interesting device
4885 TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, "RPI: Opening input device: %s (%s%s%s%s%s)", device,
4886 worker->isMouse? "mouse " : "",
4887 worker->isMultitouch? "multitouch " : "",
4888 worker->isTouch? "touchscreen " : "",
4889 worker->isGamepad? "gamepad " : "",
4890 worker->isKeyboard? "keyboard " : "");
4891
4892 // Create a thread for this device
4893 int error = pthread_create(&worker->threadId, NULL, &EventThread, (void *)worker);
4894 if (error != 0)
4895 {
4896 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "RPI: Failed to create input device thread: %s (error: %d)", device, error);
4897 worker->threadId = 0;
4898 close(fd);
4899 }
4900
4901#if defined(USE_LAST_TOUCH_DEVICE)
4902 // Find touchscreen with the highest index
4903 int maxTouchNumber = -1;
4904
4905 for (int i = 0; i < sizeof(CORE.Input.eventWorker)/sizeof(InputEventWorker); ++i)
4906 {
4907 if (CORE.Input.eventWorker[i].isTouch && (CORE.Input.eventWorker[i].eventNum > maxTouchNumber)) maxTouchNumber = CORE.Input.eventWorker[i].eventNum;
4908 }
4909
4910 // Find toucnscreens with lower indexes
4911 for (int i = 0; i < sizeof(CORE.Input.eventWorker)/sizeof(InputEventWorker); ++i)
4912 {
4913 if (CORE.Input.eventWorker[i].isTouch && (CORE.Input.eventWorker[i].eventNum < maxTouchNumber))
4914 {
4915 if (CORE.Input.eventWorker[i].threadId != 0)
4916 {
4917 TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "RPI: Found duplicate touchscreen, killing touchscreen on event: %d", i);
4918 pthread_cancel(CORE.Input.eventWorker[i].threadId);
4919 close(CORE.Input.eventWorker[i].fd);
4920 }
4921 }
4922 }
4923#endif
4924 }
4925 else close(fd); // We are not interested in this device
4926 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4927}
4928
4929// Input device events reading thread
4930static void *EventThread(void *arg)
4931{
4932 // Scancode to keycode mapping for US keyboards
4933 // TODO: Probably replace this with a keymap from the X11 to get the correct regional map for the keyboard:
4934 // Currently non US keyboards will have the wrong mapping for some keys
4935 static const int keymap_US[] =
4936 { 0,256,49,50,51,52,53,54,55,56,57,48,45,61,259,258,81,87,69,82,84,
4937 89,85,73,79,80,91,93,257,341,65,83,68,70,71,72,74,75,76,59,39,96,
4938 340,92,90,88,67,86,66,78,77,44,46,47,344,332,342,32,280,290,291,
4939 292,293,294,295,296,297,298,299,282,281,327,328,329,333,324,325,
4940 326,334,321,322,323,320,330,0,85,86,300,301,89,90,91,92,93,94,95,
4941 335,345,331,283,346,101,268,265,266,263,262,269,264,267,260,261,
4942 112,113,114,115,116,117,118,119,120,121,122,123,124,125,347,127,
4943 128,129,130,131,132,133,134,135,136,137,138,139,140,141,142,143,
4944 144,145,146,147,148,149,150,151,152,153,154,155,156,157,158,159,
4945 160,161,162,163,164,165,166,167,168,169,170,171,172,173,174,175,
4946 176,177,178,179,180,181,182,183,184,185,186,187,188,189,190,191,
4947 192,193,194,0,0,0,0,0,200,201,202,203,204,205,206,207,208,209,210,
4948 211,212,213,214,215,216,217,218,219,220,221,222,223,224,225,226,
4949 227,228,229,230,231,232,233,234,235,236,237,238,239,240,241,242,
4950 243,244,245,246,247,248,0,0,0,0,0,0,0, };
4951
4952 struct input_event event;
4953 InputEventWorker *worker = (InputEventWorker *)arg;
4954
4955 int touchAction = -1;
4956 bool gestureUpdate = false;
4957 int keycode;
4958
4959 while (!CORE.Window.shouldClose)
4960 {
4961 // Try to read data from the device and only continue if successful
4962 if (read(worker->fd, &event, sizeof(event)) == (int)sizeof(event))
4963 {
4964 // Relative movement parsing
4965 if (event.type == EV_REL)
4966 {
4967 if (event.code == REL_X)
4968 {
4969 CORE.Input.Mouse.position.x += event.value;
4970 CORE.Input.Touch.position[0].x = CORE.Input.Mouse.position.x;
4971
4972 #if defined(SUPPORT_GESTURES_SYSTEM)
4973 touchAction = TOUCH_MOVE;
4974 gestureUpdate = true;
4975 #endif
4976 }
4977
4978 if (event.code == REL_Y)
4979 {
4980 CORE.Input.Mouse.position.y += event.value;
4981 CORE.Input.Touch.position[0].y = CORE.Input.Mouse.position.y;
4982
4983 #if defined(SUPPORT_GESTURES_SYSTEM)
4984 touchAction = TOUCH_MOVE;
4985 gestureUpdate = true;
4986 #endif
4987 }
4988
4989 if (event.code == REL_WHEEL) CORE.Input.Mouse.currentWheelMove += event.value;
4990 }
4991
4992 // Absolute movement parsing
4993 if (event.type == EV_ABS)
4994 {
4995 // Basic movement
4996 if (event.code == ABS_X)
4997 {
4998 CORE.Input.Mouse.position.x = (event.value - worker->absRange.x)*CORE.Window.screen.width/worker->absRange.width; // Scale acording to absRange
4999
5000 #if defined(SUPPORT_GESTURES_SYSTEM)
5001 touchAction = TOUCH_MOVE;
5002 gestureUpdate = true;
5003 #endif
5004 }
5005
5006 if (event.code == ABS_Y)
5007 {
5008 CORE.Input.Mouse.position.y = (event.value - worker->absRange.y)*CORE.Window.screen.height/worker->absRange.height; // Scale acording to absRange
5009
5010 #if defined(SUPPORT_GESTURES_SYSTEM)
5011 touchAction = TOUCH_MOVE;
5012 gestureUpdate = true;
5013 #endif
5014 }
5015
5016 // Multitouch movement
5017 if (event.code == ABS_MT_SLOT) worker->touchSlot = event.value; // Remeber the slot number for the folowing events
5018
5019 if (event.code == ABS_MT_POSITION_X)
5020 {
5021 if (worker->touchSlot < MAX_TOUCH_POINTS) CORE.Input.Touch.position[worker->touchSlot].x = (event.value - worker->absRange.x)*CORE.Window.screen.width/worker->absRange.width; // Scale acording to absRange
5022 }
5023
5024 if (event.code == ABS_MT_POSITION_Y)
5025 {
5026 if (worker->touchSlot < MAX_TOUCH_POINTS) CORE.Input.Touch.position[worker->touchSlot].y = (event.value - worker->absRange.y)*CORE.Window.screen.height/worker->absRange.height; // Scale acording to absRange
5027 }
5028
5029 if (event.code == ABS_MT_TRACKING_ID)
5030 {
5031 if ((event.value < 0) && (worker->touchSlot < MAX_TOUCH_POINTS))
5032 {
5033 // Touch has ended for this point
5034 CORE.Input.Touch.position[worker->touchSlot].x = -1;
5035 CORE.Input.Touch.position[worker->touchSlot].y = -1;
5036 }
5037 }
5038 }
5039
5040 // Button parsing
5041 if (event.type == EV_KEY)
5042 {
5043 // Mouse button parsing
5044 if ((event.code == BTN_TOUCH) || (event.code == BTN_LEFT))
5045 {
5046 CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonStateEvdev[MOUSE_LEFT_BUTTON] = event.value;
5047
5048 #if defined(SUPPORT_GESTURES_SYSTEM)
5049 if (event.value > 0) touchAction = TOUCH_DOWN;
5050 else touchAction = TOUCH_UP;
5051 gestureUpdate = true;
5052 #endif
5053 }
5054
5055 if (event.code == BTN_RIGHT) CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonStateEvdev[MOUSE_RIGHT_BUTTON] = event.value;
5056 if (event.code == BTN_MIDDLE) CORE.Input.Mouse.currentButtonStateEvdev[MOUSE_MIDDLE_BUTTON] = event.value;
5057
5058 // Keyboard button parsing
5059 if ((event.code >= 1) && (event.code <= 255)) //Keyboard keys appear for codes 1 to 255
5060 {
5061 keycode = keymap_US[event.code & 0xFF]; // The code we get is a scancode so we look up the apropriate keycode
5062
5063 // Make sure we got a valid keycode
5064 if ((keycode > 0) && (keycode < sizeof(CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState)))
5065 {
5066 /* Disabled buffer !!
5067 // Store the key information for raylib to later use
5068 CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[keycode] = event.value;
5069 if (event.value > 0)
5070 {
5071 // Add the key int the fifo
5072 CORE.Input.Keyboard.lastKeyPressed.contents[CORE.Input.Keyboard.lastKeyPressed.head] = keycode; // Put the data at the front of the fifo snake
5073 CORE.Input.Keyboard.lastKeyPressed.head = (CORE.Input.Keyboard.lastKeyPressed.head + 1) & 0x07; // Increment the head pointer forwards and binary wraparound after 7 (fifo is 8 elements long)
5074 // TODO: This fifo is not fully threadsafe with multiple writers, so multiple keyboards hitting a key at the exact same time could miss a key (double write to head before it was incremented)
5075 }
5076 */
5077
5078 CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[keycode] = event.value;
5079 if (event.value == 1)
5080 {
5081 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueue[CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount] = keycode; // Register last key pressed
5082 CORE.Input.Keyboard.keyPressedQueueCount++;
5083 }
5084
5085 #if defined(SUPPORT_SCREEN_CAPTURE)
5086 // Check screen capture key (raylib key: KEY_F12)
5087 if (CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[301] == 1)
5088 {
5089 TakeScreenshot(FormatText("screenshot%03i.png", screenshotCounter));
5090 screenshotCounter++;
5091 }
5092 #endif
5093
5094 if (CORE.Input.Keyboard.currentKeyState[CORE.Input.Keyboard.exitKey] == 1) CORE.Window.shouldClose = true;
5095
5096 TRACELOGD("RPI: KEY_%s ScanCode: %4i KeyCode: %4i", event.value == 0 ? "UP":"DOWN", event.code, keycode);
5097 }
5098 }
5099 }
5100
5101 // Screen confinement
5102 if (CORE.Input.Mouse.position.x < 0) CORE.Input.Mouse.position.x = 0;
5103 if (CORE.Input.Mouse.position.x > CORE.Window.screen.width/CORE.Input.Mouse.scale.x) CORE.Input.Mouse.position.x = CORE.Window.screen.width/CORE.Input.Mouse.scale.x;
5104
5105 if (CORE.Input.Mouse.position.y < 0) CORE.Input.Mouse.position.y = 0;
5106 if (CORE.Input.Mouse.position.y > CORE.Window.screen.height/CORE.Input.Mouse.scale.y) CORE.Input.Mouse.position.y = CORE.Window.screen.height/CORE.Input.Mouse.scale.y;
5107
5108 // Gesture update
5109 if (gestureUpdate)
5110 {
5111 #if defined(SUPPORT_GESTURES_SYSTEM)
5112 GestureEvent gestureEvent = { 0 };
5113
5114 gestureEvent.pointCount = 0;
5115 gestureEvent.touchAction = touchAction;
5116
5117 if (CORE.Input.Touch.position[0].x >= 0) gestureEvent.pointCount++;
5118 if (CORE.Input.Touch.position[1].x >= 0) gestureEvent.pointCount++;
5119 if (CORE.Input.Touch.position[2].x >= 0) gestureEvent.pointCount++;
5120 if (CORE.Input.Touch.position[3].x >= 0) gestureEvent.pointCount++;
5121
5122 gestureEvent.pointerId[0] = 0;
5123 gestureEvent.pointerId[1] = 1;
5124 gestureEvent.pointerId[2] = 2;
5125 gestureEvent.pointerId[3] = 3;
5126
5127 gestureEvent.position[0] = CORE.Input.Touch.position[0];
5128 gestureEvent.position[1] = CORE.Input.Touch.position[1];
5129 gestureEvent.position[2] = CORE.Input.Touch.position[2];
5130 gestureEvent.position[3] = CORE.Input.Touch.position[3];
5131
5132 ProcessGestureEvent(gestureEvent);
5133 #endif
5134 }
5135 }
5136 else
5137 {
5138 usleep(5000); // Sleep for 5ms to avoid hogging CPU time
5139 }
5140 }
5141
5142 close(worker->fd);
5143
5144 return NULL;
5145}
5146
5147// Init gamepad system
5148static void InitGamepad(void)
5149{
5150 char gamepadDev[128] = "";
5151
5152 for (int i = 0; i < MAX_GAMEPADS; i++)
5153 {
5154 sprintf(gamepadDev, "%s%i", DEFAULT_GAMEPAD_DEV, i);
5155
5156 if ((CORE.Input.Gamepad.streamId[i] = open(gamepadDev, O_RDONLY|O_NONBLOCK)) < 0)
5157 {
5158 // NOTE: Only show message for first gamepad
5159 if (i == 0) TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "RPI: Failed to open Gamepad device, no gamepad available");
5160 }
5161 else
5162 {
5163 CORE.Input.Gamepad.ready[i] = true;
5164
5165 // NOTE: Only create one thread
5166 if (i == 0)
5167 {
5168 int error = pthread_create(&CORE.Input.Gamepad.threadId, NULL, &GamepadThread, NULL);
5169
5170 if (error != 0) TRACELOG(LOG_WARNING, "RPI: Failed to create gamepad input event thread");
5171 else TRACELOG(LOG_INFO, "RPI: Gamepad device initialized successfully");
5172 }
5173 }
5174 }
5175}
5176
5177// Process Gamepad (/dev/input/js0)
5178static void *GamepadThread(void *arg)
5179{
5180 #define JS_EVENT_BUTTON 0x01 // Button pressed/released
5181 #define JS_EVENT_AXIS 0x02 // Joystick axis moved
5182 #define JS_EVENT_INIT 0x80 // Initial state of device
5183
5184 struct js_event {
5185 unsigned int time; // event timestamp in milliseconds
5186 short value; // event value
5187 unsigned char type; // event type
5188 unsigned char number; // event axis/button number
5189 };
5190
5191 // Read gamepad event
5192 struct js_event gamepadEvent;
5193
5194 while (!CORE.Window.shouldClose)
5195 {
5196 for (int i = 0; i < MAX_GAMEPADS; i++)
5197 {
5198 if (read(CORE.Input.Gamepad.streamId[i], &gamepadEvent, sizeof(struct js_event)) == (int)sizeof(struct js_event))
5199 {
5200 gamepadEvent.type &= ~JS_EVENT_INIT; // Ignore synthetic events
5201
5202 // Process gamepad events by type
5203 if (gamepadEvent.type == JS_EVENT_BUTTON)
5204 {
5205 TRACELOGD("RPI: Gamepad button: %i, value: %i", gamepadEvent.number, gamepadEvent.value);
5206
5207 if (gamepadEvent.number < MAX_GAMEPAD_BUTTONS)
5208 {
5209 // 1 - button pressed, 0 - button released
5210 CORE.Input.Gamepad.currentState[i][gamepadEvent.number] = (int)gamepadEvent.value;
5211
5212 if ((int)gamepadEvent.value == 1) CORE.Input.Gamepad.lastButtonPressed = gamepadEvent.number;
5213 else CORE.Input.Gamepad.lastButtonPressed = -1;
5214 }
5215 }
5216 else if (gamepadEvent.type == JS_EVENT_AXIS)
5217 {
5218 TRACELOGD("RPI: Gamepad axis: %i, value: %i", gamepadEvent.number, gamepadEvent.value);
5219
5220 if (gamepadEvent.number < MAX_GAMEPAD_AXIS)
5221 {
5222 // NOTE: Scaling of gamepadEvent.value to get values between -1..1
5223 CORE.Input.Gamepad.axisState[i][gamepadEvent.number] = (float)gamepadEvent.value/32768;
5224 }
5225 }
5226 }
5227 else
5228 {
5229 usleep(1000); //Sleep for 1ms to avoid hogging CPU time
5230 }
5231 }
5232 }
5233
5234 return NULL;
5235}
5236#endif // PLATFORM_RPI
